review_title: Battery issue and no joy from seller
review_text: I'm sure this is a good phone, but the one I received had a defective battery. The phone would shut down seemingly at random even if the battery was in the 80-90%  range with a sudden message to say the battery was depleted and the phone was shutting down. It rendered it completely unreliable and unusable. The seller did respond to my messages but erratically and after several attempts to get some support and days later nowhere further forward I reluctantly asked to return the phone for a refund which the seller agreed to. I had to pay the postage (Â£8) myself and weeks later am still waiting for either an acknowledgement of my return or any refund of my money. The phone itself seemed really good when it was working and I think the one I had was not a good representative sample but I'm infuriated by the seller's attitude and would certainly not buy from them again.Edit - after a number of attempts to contact the seller they did issue a refund after around a month and a half.

title: Huawei Mate 10 Pro (Single-SIM) 128GB Android 8.0 UK version SIM-Free Smartphone -Titanium Grey
review_text: Have had the Mate 10 Pro for a couple of months and really like it. I am a very experienced smartphone user (just adding that as a lot of reviews for phones on Amazon are often by very clueless people) and have had numerous Android phones, and I upgraded from a Samsung S7 Edge.It has a nice 6" screen, but because of the small bezels it doesn't feel large in the hands or pocket at all. The cameras (colour and B&W) are really good, I am an experienced photographer with good cameras and lenses, and normally hate phone cameras, but this is the first phone I have owned where I will use it when out and about and not have to carry a camera with me all the time. The low light pictures are frankly amazing for a phone.Battery life is excellent, I can easily go a day on a charge, and it recharges to full in less than an hour using the supplied USB-C charger.It comes with minimal extra apps installed over standard Android. I can't speak much about the UI for the homescreen as I always use Nova Launcher, but the settings menus are well laid out and have a lot of useful features. Performance of the phone is very good, and the 6GB of RAM helps a lot.Phone comes with screen protector applied in the box, and also a transparent protection case.Downsides:This is the first USB-C device I have owned, and it has no headphone jack. It does have a USB-C to headphone jack dongle which does the job. It has a pair of earphones bundles in, but while the sound quality was pretty decent, they don't stay in my ears at all, they are very poorly shaped with no rubber cover to help them stay in. It has no MicroSD slot, but with 128GB of internal storage that isn't an issue for me.Overall it is a fantastic phone that performs like a flagship model but costs less than half the price. Is a real bargain IMO.

title: Huawei Mate 10 Pro (Single-SIM) 128GB Android 8.0 UK version SIM-Free Smartphone -Titanium Grey
review_text: After buying a Huawei tablet (MediaPad M3 10 lit, 5*) and loving the build quality I decided to make my next phone Huawei. Decided on the Mate 10 Pro coz it had no notch and a 96hr battery rating on GSM Arena.What can I say? Awesome. Very good looks, solid build and it does have that great battery.The Emui skin is not too intrusive but I always put Nova Launcher on for my own customisation.It comes with a clear case, screen protector applied, fast charge brick and some USB-C earphones (and a 3.5mm to USB-C  for normal earphones you may want to use).The screen is great. The new 18:9 ratio that most phones seem to have means it's taller but narrower, easier on the pocket.It does have some strong power saving modes as default but you can soon sort out which ones to turn off. The battery life is really good. After a full, first charge, it took me 8hrs setting it up, with screen full brightness to run it down. Very impressive. After a few days with it being used normally, it easily gets through a day. Sometimes with 60% still left!The audio is another strong point. Using some hi res earphones I get some good, clear audio. I mostly use Spotify at very high quality. I did notice it doesn't like third party equalisers, preferring it's own, very customisable app. Using its own external speakers the phone uses a downward firing port for the lows while the earpiece handles the treble. However, switch to landscape mode, for video viewing and the two speakers then also split the audio to stereo too. Very good idea.The camera is very good, plenty of modes, though to be honest, I don't use it that often. A few stills, when out with friends etc but they look crystal clear.6gb of ram is more than enough to handle the four constant widgets I have on my home screen and still show no signs of lag.As this model has been superceded by the Mate 20 and P20 models, it's now over half the price it was a year ago. Also, although it's a year old, it still has Android 8 so still pretty much up to date, software wise.It's a great phone, that battery is phenomenal. Very happy with this purchase.

title: Huawei Mate 10 Pro (Single-SIM) 128GB Android 8.0 UK version SIM-Free Smartphone -Titanium Grey
review_title: Late 2017 Flagship for half price! Result!
review_text: Okay my LG G4 finally went bootloop after just over 3 years. So I needed a new phone. I'm never that much of a mug to pay more than Â£400 for a phone if I have to so took a look at what was going on Amazon for Â£250 to Â£400. So we had the Nokia 8 which looked great and super cheap but no notification light. Google Pixel XL MK1...great again but comes out of update support right now so no point. The LG G6 was looking solid if a little dull but I fancied a change maybe. Then the Mate 10 Pro was up. Great looking camera, half the launch price and plenty of storage. The other thing was the 4000mAh battery. If I can't change them at least I'll get a phone with a bigger battery. Oh and it has a notification light.Sold!Okay the phone took nearly a week to arrive but hey. First niggle is the charging cable is 18" too short. The phone itself is great. I made sure I left the screen protector on by peeling the removal tab off instead. Into the case it went. Power on and two updates went straight on which was a good start. I then put back my apps and installed MS Launcher as I didn't want to get involved with EMUI. MS Launcher gives me the most barebones launcher once its tweaked as I want it.I was able to remove/disable 80% of the pre-installed stuff. The only stuff I couldn't was the usual own brand contacts/mail/messaging type stuff. Not terrible I suppose.So speed it great, as is the screen. You can change the screen colour but it comes pretty settled out of the box. The camera seems great though I haven't done much yet. B&W photography does look gorgeous I have to say. I don't take selfies being a 47 year old bloke.I don't listen to music on my phone so the loss of headphone jack is not an issue nor is wireless charging.One feature I miss from the G4 is the split audio levels for ringtone and notifications. Also I have to say the notification light on the 10 pro is a bit pathetic. It's the tiniest LED. Womp Womp!Battery life is tough to call as I'm still in the honeymoon period but it will do me fine I think.It's since dropped another Â£15 since I ordered it so even more or a bargain!Here's hoping it lasts me three years!Edit - As of Jan 8th, all going well, super well in fact. I got the Android Pie upgrade pushed to my phone about three days ago (about the 5th update I've had since October so not bad). Very nice indeed. Was amazed when the price jumped from the Â£360 I paid to Â£699 but seems to be coming back down now.

title: Huawei P40 Lite - Smartphone 128GB, 6GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_title: Physically good phone: software is a mess without Google Play
review_text: The phone itself is well designed and the physical devices - sound, camera, sensors, telephone/music etc., all work very well. But the Huawei App Store is extremely limited.Whilst there are lots of videos and other explanations on the web telling you how to get Google Play Store and the Google Account Manager working with this phone the reality is that success is very far from guaranteed, and installing them may make the Huawei Android EMUI OS unstable. Sideloading apps from other third-party sites may or may not work reliably, especially if those apps depend in any way on a working instance of Google Play or Google Account Manager.In short: Mea Culpa, buyer beware. It's a good phone if you don't depend on Google in any way. Otherwise, avoid it with prejudice.

title: Huawei P20 Pro 128GB Dual-SIM Factory Unlocked 4G/LTE Smartphone (Black)
review_text: I have been an iPhone user since the very first day it was launched and in that time have had every iteration of the iPhone up to the X.I tried Android phones a couple of times but was underwhelmed, however this phone has changed all of that.I bought it as I use the camera on my phone a lot, for me its the most important function other than the phone of course.Incidentally this phone also has 2 SIM cards which I need as I live between 2 countries.This phone takes fantastic pictures and is especially good in low light situations.The build quality is exceptional and it has a striking colour scheme (twilight).In the past I felt Apples closed environment was preferable but now Android has more than caught up.I was particularly impressed with how easy it was to make the transfer for iOS to Android. Merely place the 2 phones on top of each other open the phone clone app and wait, after about 20 minutes my new Android was virtually he same as my old iPhone X but about Â£300 cheaper. Thats a lot to to pay for a name!Other than that there is little to say.Sound = *****Build = *****Camera = *****Ease of transfer and use = *****Dual SIMSo far there has been nothing to complain about this phone. If it carries on in this manner I will be sticking to Android.Apple are producing a dual SIM phone this year but new features like this always seem to lag behind Android whereas in the past Apple was head of the pack.Sorry Apple, you lost me...

title: Huawei P20 Pro 128GB Dual-SIM Factory Unlocked 4G/LTE Smartphone (Black)
review_title: Recommended! Huawei P20 Pro Dual Sim.
review_text: Really have loved this phone, since day one.  Poor experiences with both Apple & Samsung, with problems and very poor customer support from both, previously, led me to buying...... And no disappointments.  Not needed support as no problems.. Have used for questions/Faqs etc.. Found support to be excellent with comprehensive understandable answers to queries etc.. Suggestions too based on questions asked... Overall impression is that Huawei Support Actually Cares about their Customers... Apple & Samsung could learn loads!Upgrades have added more & more ads which I find annoying as they are forced until time out/skip option.. That and the political situation with USA are the only negatives so far and I'm almost 2 years in.  Battery is still very good too.  Could not say same for either Apple 6s or Samsung S8 and given this P20 Pro is Dual Sim it does the jobs of both those phones and still is!

title: Huawei P20 Pro 128GB Dual-SIM Factory Unlocked 4G/LTE Smartphone (Black)
review_text: I ended up buying 3 of these - one for me and the other two for my sons for Christmas. Reason I got one myself was that I couldn't believe the price so opened mine before the Amazon 30 day return (before Christmas)... Personally I moved from being a life long Samsung owner but now this kit has literally blown the Samsung's out of the water for functionality and value. The OS is so simple to use and not bloated with non-useable apps etc. So speedy and so far exceptionally reliable. Not a single issue - Turned it on, transferred from my old Android and then it did a system update. Battery life is brilliant - charge every couple of days if that.. I was so impressed with Huawei that I went and bought the Huawei watch 2 (got it yesterday in an Amazon deal so still playing).. Would recommend Huawei if looking for great value and high specs. I'm converted ! P.s. Kids are blow away with the phones too - which is really who they were bought for.

title: Huawei P20 Pro 128GB Dual-SIM Factory Unlocked 4G/LTE Smartphone (Black)
review_title: Great camera lens (s)on it. Plenty of space for music. Easy to communicate in various modes
review_text: I have been using  the P20 pro for about 4 months  and I have to say I like it , no what the scare stories about Huawei say. Its got plenty of memory(128 Gig). The camera is as good as some of my point and shoot ones, with plenty of apps on it as well for effects.The screen is a descent size, and makes  WhatsApp easy to use.One thing I don't like is all the Notifications one gets. I know you can turn them off. Kind of annoying. Privacy is probably right out the window. If Chinese authorities have my Contacts List you can betya CIA, Mi6 etc does too. So what the hell. If you are really into privacy, what phone would be the one??I got this to replace my IPhone 5E and it beats it by miles. And no more ITunes. Its easy to load in mp3 files into the P20 without messy controlly secondary apps like ITunes. I have since deleted ITunes and any Apple remains from my PC. Happy days.So, I do like the Huawei P20 for the camera and the music you can load. Comms is easy --Phone, Facebook, Messenger, WhatApp, Zoom etc. Best buy for a phone I've made in years

review_title: Great phone at a great price
review_text: I bought this phone on the recommendation of a friend, and I am really happy with it. Battery life is great, due in part to the quite aggressive optimisation that the software is doing (closing apps in the background or limiting what they do), which can be adjusted if deemed too aggressive. Display is bright and beautiful, cameras are amazing (even though the 5x optical zoom is the one most reviewers rave about, I love the wide angle camera, which is great for urban photography). The phone charges ridiculously quickly with the included charger and even the wireless charging works well. All in all, a solid phone even though it's last year model. The only thing missing is 5G, but I don't ever find myself wishing my data connection was speedier when I'm out and about, since a good strong 4G signal does what I need quite quickly, so I'll wait until my next phone for the 5G connectivity.

title: Huawei P10 Lite t mobile SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: Bought this as a replacement for an old Xperia which had a faulty sound card and so I had to get a new phone because I use it mainly for music on the go. Also I don't use the phone as much as some users since I commute by bike,so I figured a "lite" phone (as in no excessive hardware that I wouldn't even make use of) would be a good buy for people like me.Pros:-Really good battery life with proper power management (wifi off during the day, mobile data off during the night, GPS always off), loses about 12% battery in ~13 hours and unnecessary apps closed, though I expect the battery life to decay after a number of charge discharge cycles.-Fingerprint reader is really fast and effective. It unlocks your phone even if you started typing your code as long as you have the correct finger on the reader. I really like this feature because it unlocks your phone instantly.-UI lets you to navigate through your music from the lockscreen (just forward and backwards). While you can do it on Android phones by enabling notifications on the lockscreen, the buttons here are bigger since it's part of the UI.-There is a tray that take both the sim card and can accept either another one or a Micro SD card, which is pretty versatile but in most case you'd just want to expand the memory.-The screen is really nice (the contrast especially) for an LCD screen.-Swiftkey was included in the phone.Cons:-The pin for removing the sim card is really easy to lose.-Some aspects of the UI may or may not appeal to some people. One of the things I do not like is the fact that there is no "start menu" to access all the programs you have, everything is on the right of the home screen (Imagine if you are using windows and all of your programs are on your desktop rather than stored in the start menu, because you don't have a start menu), and that you don't have the ability to sort apps alphabetically or by usage frequency etc, so you have to remember where you put them. Accessing swiftkey settings for example wasn't straightforward at all (hint: it's not in the homescreen).Some other thoughts/information:-The camera is decent, it's what you would expect of a phone camera. I'm happy with ~13 mpix, at least it makes e-mail/whatsapp attachments lighter and faster to upload.-It uses the smallest of the SIM card size, you might have to go to your operator if you have older generation phones.-There is some bass boost turned on by default (little SWS icon) which you can disable once and for all if you are listening to the music. If you have proper headphones this option should never be turned on._________Overall I think it is very good value for the money hardware wise. The image quality is very good and I don't have any complaints about the audio quality. I have tried Hearthstone on it and it doesn't seem to lag either, so I think performance wise it is also pretty good.Some improvements could be done in the UI for sorting applications in general.

title: Huawei P10 Lite t mobile SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: This is judged from the viewpoint of an ex-Galaxy Fame user of a few years. Which means virtually any recent smartphone will seem outstanding, especially as it was on a Vodafone contract - the least user friendly service provider I suspect.I am still at the stage of finding my way with it, some settings yet to be tailored to the optimum for my usage. So far I'm delighted. Bought it sim free, from Amazon, at about a third of the cost of the market leaders, Android or Apple. Got an excellent Sim-only deal from Plusnet, for half what Vodafone were charging me, but with three times the service offerings. The savings will pay for the phone within the sim contract period, give or take.Build quality is excellent, everything works as it should, 32Gb internal storage I've supplemented with another 32Gb external sd card. Plenty for my needs. 4Gb ram seems to cope so far. Can't find anything but praise for the Huawei P10 lite. Had I been using a more competent phone previously I could probably be more specific with my review, just leave it at - love it!

title: Huawei P10 Lite t mobile SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: The P-10 lite came in immaculate condition. It was cased in its original Huawei box with ALL the original brand new sealed accessories inclusive of an USB and transparent phone case. The phone is super easy to use, it actually resembles an iPhone although I honestly think the Huawei P-10 lite is better especially with the use of fingerprint unlock positioned at the back of the phone, which enables you to comfortably unlock your phone whilst still holding it in one hand. The phone has a great slim/thin design but still feels sturdy, the screen is a large size, comforting to the eye. Itâ€™s easily able to slip in your pocket too. After getting the P-10 Smart I immediately saw the brand new P-Smart advertised at a relatively low price, I ALMOST regretted getting the P-10 lite but after a week of using the pristine secondhand P-10 lite, I have no regrets whatsoever. A great phone with all its hidden great features. Exceptional good value for money.

title: Huawei P10 Lite t mobile SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: This phone was phenomenal to have. Great price and came looking completely new. It was fast, efficient and had a very sleek design (even if makes phone a bit slippy). The durability of this phone is amazing as I purchased it 5 years ago and it still works well today! Only issue is the screen cracked recently, and the memory is a bit small, so would recommend a SD card, so unfortunately have to get something new. May be a bit dated now in terms of modern phones, but it still holds up for someone who does not necessarily want the most up to date phone. Great purchase and could not recommend more!

I had Samsung galaxy S5 before and I wasnt sure if this phone will be as good.....but I have to say.....it is even better! After I had so many problems with Galaxy S5 and I had few of them, I do not regret my choice.P10 Lite is super fast. You are not waiting for anything. It reacts immediately. Internet works perfect. Fingerscanner is absolutely amazing, I love it (on S5 it didnt work at all). Battery lasts longer, sometimes nearly two days. The only thing not as good as on S5 is the camera. Pictures might be slightly worse, but it is not as significant, and they still look very good.And the body of the phone looks and feels very sophisticated.The only thing I cant tell now, is how long is the phone gonna last for in such a good condition, because I know that most samsungs just starts doing funny things after some time and get slow etc. So I will see.I highly recommend this phone, I would definitely buy it again.

title: Huawei Y6 2019 32 GB 6.09 inch FullView Dewdrop Display Smartphone with 13 MP Camera, Android 9.0 Sim-Free Mobile Phone, UK Version, Midnight Black
review_text: I've always used the most recent Samsung flagships, but I recently lost my S10+ and needed a cheaper phone to tide me over until I can upgrade to the S20 Ultra. While this phone can't really compete with the powerhouses on the market, it represents amazing value for money, and it will do everything that you need it to do without breaking your bank. It has a clear, crisp display, a brilliant battery life, and it runs with with minimal lag. The rear camera is shockingly good considering the price point, although the front camera leaves a lot to be desired. The fingerprint sensor works perfectly, and if you're concerned about security, this particular Huawei device is Play Protect certified. The only real flaw is the loudspeaker quality, but I almost always use headphones so this is a non-issue for me personally. Overall, I thoroughly recommend this phone, and it's nowhere near as big of a downgrade as I was expecting coming from the S10+.

title: Huawei Y6 2019 32 GB 6.09 inch FullView Dewdrop Display Smartphone with 13 MP Camera, Android 9.0 Sim-Free Mobile Phone, UK Version, Midnight Black
review_text: It was easy to set up - the phone clone app was able to transfer everything from my old phone pretty quickly. It works well, though I haven't found a way to put the apps onto the SD card so the internal memory is already quite full. The facial recognition unlock works pretty well, but doesn't work in the dark which does make me miss the fingerprint unlock. There's some good security features - I particularly like the ability to lock apps so they can only be accessed with the unlock code which adds a layer of protection, especially for banking apps.

title: Huawei Y6 2019 32 GB 6.09 inch FullView Dewdrop Display Smartphone with 13 MP Camera, Android 9.0 Sim-Free Mobile Phone, UK Version, Midnight Black

Canâ€™t fault it at all, easily one of the best phones for a good price. Recommend.

review_text: Just wanted to put an update on the phone.I got it in 2020, its now November 2022 and the phone is still working great, never had any issues at all, definitely would recommend to anyone needing a phone at a cheaper price!*******Very surprised how good the quality the phone is, I've had it for about 4 months and had no problems with it, I use it everyday because I broke iPhone, and it works just as good. Its really fast. The only thing negative is the camera. It's still pretty good however it does make things pretty smooth and it's not good as and iPhone or Samsung, you can't use Google pay either but for the price you really can't complain.

title: Huawei Y6 2019 32 GB 6.09 inch FullView Dewdrop Display Smartphone with 13 MP Camera, Android 9.0 Sim-Free Mobile Phone, UK Version, Midnight Black
review_text: The phone is really easy to use but I think the system is abit slow. The camera is really shocking I bearly take pictures on it. I bought a huawei because I heard sch good things about them, but I recon spending abit more money and getting better ones up is what you should do if you want to be able to take good pics, if not its alright. title: Sony Xperia 10 V Black - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_text: I've been using this phone for just under a month now so I thought I would write a review to let others know who can't decide.I've had a Samsung Galaxy phone since the S2. They did everything I wanted them to but my S9+ was nearly 5 years old and on its last legs and I refuse to pay Â£1000 for a phone that I can't plug my headphones into or get expandable storage which limits you to Xperia and the odd Chinese made phone.I have been pleasantly surprised at how capable this phone is.What I like:The headphone jack - messed with a few settings and was happy with the sound output in the endExpandable storage - which seems to work well with the Google files appThe battery can easily last 2 days in this - sometimes I have gone for 3 days without a charge. Although I must say its not exactly the fastest charging phone I have ever had but I wonder if it might not have better battery longevity as a result.This phone is very light in comparison to my last 2 Galaxy phones - I quite like the extra thickness. Makes it more pleasant to hold.I like that the screen is flat and not curved at the edges - I can get full coverage from the screen protectorWhat I am satisfied with:The screen is quite satisfactory even if it isn't AMOLED quality.The 21:9 screen ratio does have its appeals - most video is in 16:9 but for scrolling through messages or reading the taller screen does have advantages. I could see this phone being really comfortable for people with smaller hands or less strength in their wrists as some of the phones these days have gotten so big.The stock android is quite responsive - I have yet to catch the phone really laggingThe connectivity - wifi, 4G/5G, hotspot, bluetooth and GPS have all worked very well - I speedtested the 5G one morning and was able to pull over 100Mb/s down! This phone gets a similar signal to any other phone I have owned.The dual speaker sound output is quite satisfactory - the volume key has to much range. You have to press the button a lot of times to make large changes.The main camera performs reasonably well - I would say its almost comparable with the one on my S9+ The telephoto and the ultrawide are satisfactory but remind me more of the Galaxy S4 camera in terms of image quality. I did some low light shooting and had mixed results. Had to take a few to get a good photo.I have found the fingerprint sensor to work better than I was expecting. In the last month of using it maybe a dozen times it has hesitated to unlock although I think in most cases some grease or dirt might have been on it. Only 1 night did it really refuse to unlock with the sensor. Not sure why.What I don't like:So far the one thing that grinds my gears - I don't like the stock music app. I know Sony prefer to keep to a stock version of android but Sony also used to be in the Walkman buisness. Could you please make a music app comparable with what the Samsung one can do?Setting up a playlist is very cumbersome on this - every time you add a track it has to ask you to allow the playlist to be modified. The other thing that caught me out was there is no support for .wma files and I found out I have a few in my music collection from a long time ago in a galaxy far far away.I also wish this phone had a gallery app that worked as well as the Samsung one but I suppose that's a minor annoyance.Another minor annoyance but I think the headphone jack is better served being on the bottom of the phone by the charging port than on the top. The only phone I remember with this set up was my S5. Its taken a bit of getting used to.Overall I would recommend this phone. I will be happy with this for the foreseeable future for what I do with it. Mostly its for messaging, YouTube, a bit of light web browsing, music, audiobooks and taking pictures. I use it for hotspot/tethering 4 days a week as well. I haven't tried to do anything really heavy duty like gaming though.

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Black - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_text: Good value daily phone with an enormous battery. I routinely only drain around 40% of the battery a day whilst using it fairly frequently. I will watch YouTube, play games, browse the web and only need to charge every other day. The screen is good and options are plentiful in the options.Only issues are that the main music app is poor, so you need to go with third party options, when you unlock the phone, it can take about two seconds before you can interact with anything and the camera's quality is pretty poor. Anything moving you will miss or get a blur and sometimes it doesn't even save the photos!

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Black - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_text: This was on special offer from Amazon (Â£270 Black Friday deal). Very nice compact phone. Battery life is super, most times a charge will last a good 5 days (light user).  It has upgraded to Android 14, and received a few updates from Sony.  Very pleased with this phone.

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Black - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_title: Did they send me a faulty one?
review_text: Looking at other reviews, I can only assume that there was something fundamentally wring with the handset I received.At the lower end of the price bracket for a new/modern phone, I don't expect to be blown away. However, this handset was unusable and is currently being returned.The fingerprint reader is terrible. It takes multiple attempts to unlock. the passcode option is unresponsive and sometimes does not register presses. There is then often a slight delay when the phone is unlocked, followed sometimes by the screen turning off again. For some reason the delay an unresponsiveness seems to lead to various button presses backing up and then being carried out in succession.The home/back/tabs bar at the bottom sometimes does not appear, so off goes the screen to be unlocked again, if it works.The phone freezes about 50% of the time when unlocked with YouTube of full screen.The phone completely crashed once when I tried to turn the wifi off. This took about 10 minutes to reboot. This was on about day three.I seem to be in the minority so maybe I got a bad one. However, I am not willing to take the risk and will buy refurb of a better phone elsewhere.

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Black - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_title: Mostly worse than my old Xperia XA2
review_text: I've had my budget Xperia XA2 for over 5 years.  It still works like it always did, but the 32GB memory is full of apps even with photos and music etc. on a 128GB SD card.  The battery even lasts all day.I saw this Xperia 10V in the Black Friday sale and bought it without checking the specs much apart from the 128GB memory.  Well, compared to my old phone, the cameras are rubbish, the display and fingerprint sensor aren't great, and there's not even an email app like all my previous Xperias have had.  I've actually gone back to my 5 year old phone!

title: Sony Xperia 1 V Black - 6.5 Inch 21:9 Wide 4K HDR OLED - 120Hz Refresh rate -Triple lens(with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS)- 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - Dual SIM hybrid
review_title: Physically strong, with quality in depth
review_text: I upgraded from a previous Xperia as I've had perfect reliability so far with Sony - and place great store on strength and this dependability.I was really looking forward to the 1V upgrades and am highly satisfied with what is a premium purchase.Standout features are the subtle design, brilliant 4K screen, surprisingly good stereo sound, flawless fingerprint login, and the camera - which rewards learning time, and experimentation with beautiful images over which I have the maximum control... a joy to use. And that camera button is just the thing to have.Having the headphone / aux jack is a real plus for quick use, although for longer sessions it pairs perfectly with the Sony LinkBuds I treated myself to and think are fantastic.It only gets warm when charging while actually in use... which isn't great for any battery's life anyway. No heat issues in extended use. Battery life great.It isn't a flashy phone. It's discreet and elegant.An iPhone will seem onscreen to take better images... but wait until you do your stuff with the raw shots out the Xperia 1V, and then compare. I was backstage onstage at a big festival and filmed an act - every face in the crowd was sharp and the new forward-facing mic adds performance.I also bought the "official" cover with stand features. It's a perfect match and the stand options ideal. I don't use it day to day as I prefer the simplest of clear, super grippy covers most of the time.So - very happy with it and still discovering features after three months!

title: Sony Xperia 1 V Black - 6.5 Inch 21:9 Wide 4K HDR OLED - 120Hz Refresh rate -Triple lens(with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS)- 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - Dual SIM hybrid
review_text: Although I've only had the phone 7 day's, to me it's a great phone and a good upgrade from my previous Xperia 1 ii.  I had a Samsung some years ago which couldn't take photo's unless you were 2 feet away and also 'fried' and damaged 2 SD cards, so when it came to looking for a decent phone I looked at Sony (I will not have anything Apple).  So far I have only had to charge it twice in the week that I have had it, the camera is brilliant and such an upgrade from the old one.  And as for the sound quality from the front facing speakers, I'm well impressed!  Admittedly that the sound quality isn't the same as coming from a proper Hi-Fi or surround sound system, or anything, but from something so small, it's extremely good. I'm still getting used to it at the moment, but I'm very impressed with it so far - which is basically what I would expect from a quality company such as Sony.

title: Sony Xperia 1 V Black - 6.5 Inch 21:9 Wide 4K HDR OLED - 120Hz Refresh rate -Triple lens(with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS)- 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - Dual SIM hybrid
review_text: I've been a loyal customer of Sony phones for nearly two decades, consistently opting for their top-tier models. However, my recent experience with this phone has been the most disappointing encounter I've had with Sony. The sound quality is subpar, the picture quality leaves much to be desired, and issues like sound and microphone cut-offs are prevalent. Worst of all, the phone's connectivity is poor, and it lacks essential programs. The camera application, in particular, has rendered this mobile phone practically unusable. I'm currently in the process of returning it to Amazon, and regrettably, I'm considering severing ties with Sony for good. I'll keep you updated on any developments."

title: Sony Xperia 1 V Black - 6.5 Inch 21:9 Wide 4K HDR OLED - 120Hz Refresh rate -Triple lens(with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS)- 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - Dual SIM hybrid
review_text: Love it. Great decision. This is best Sony phone ever made. Camera is top notch. I don't understand negative reviews I've had none of those issues with battery overheating and stuff. title: Sony Xperia 1 V Black - 6.5 Inch 21:9 Wide 4K HDR OLED - 120Hz Refresh rate -Triple lens(with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS)- 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - Dual SIM hybrid
review_text: I upgraded from a Sony Xperia 1 III to Sony Xperia 1 IV to Sony Xperia 1 V+headphone jack (important for me)+can add external memory (important for me)+Battery size the same from IV BUT due to the CPU change, the battery lasts MUCH longer+Phone overheating from the last 2 models especially the last one seems to be gone (or improved loads).+stereo speakers are quite good (improved even from the IV)+/- Default gallery is 'Google Photos, however it's only useful if you pay an annual charge, so found 'Simple Gallery Pro' for a one off price Â£0.79 which is quite good.+/- Had to get Nova Launcher to help organise my apps section. Odd that by default it doesn't let you group/hide apps-no phone charger I understand why, still for a premium product and price I would have expected it.-headphone promotion is time limited per vendor and you have to go to Sony direct vs when you get it along with the phone in the past. I just missed out on it, which is a massive shame. Prefer the past methods. Seems tight for a premium product promotion.-price was about Â£100-200 more than last yearâ€™s model, which was already an expensive phone.Overall very happy with the phone.Side note: I had an issue where only 1 usb A->C cable would allow me to connect to the phone drive, after trying loads of different cables (that all worked on the III and IV fine), I bought a PCIE Expansion Card and it worked off that.

title: Sony Xperia 5 V â€“ Black - 6.1â€ 21:9 HDR OLED 120Hz - Triple Focal Length (with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS) - 3.5mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 8GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM
review_text: Compared to the previous phone, I had the Sony Xperia 5 III,  this one is a bit better. The size is more or less the same, which is good. The battery keeps a bit longer. The camera is better and I like that there are more options in the basic mode. Overall the phone looks better and I am happy with it, but it has one thing which disappointed me a lot... Now I have to check the phone all the time to know if I have a message or something.

title: Sony Xperia 5 V â€“ Black - 6.1â€ 21:9 HDR OLED 120Hz - Triple Focal Length (with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS) - 3.5mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 8GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM
review_text: I love my Xperia, been using Sony phones for years,

title: Sony Xperia 5 V â€“ Black - 6.1â€ 21:9 HDR OLED 120Hz - Triple Focal Length (with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS) - 3.5mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 8GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM
review_text: The main things I love: the design, the two SIMs (eSIM+SIM), the microSD slot and the headphone jack I use daily. I don't dislike at all the 21:9 format, even if you don't watch movies, it's great for multitasking and keeps the width of the phone within more manageable limits. Let's be clear, it's far from being a compact & light phone, but the build quality and feel is great. The phone is fast and smooth, the camera is compartment is good although not revolutionary, the fingerprint reader is very fast and accurate and the battery is very good if you don't hammer it. Great photo & video apps, but that's all, I can't think of any other pro.The so so part: the audio quality could be better and the equilizer is not very effective too. The weight is okay, but definitely not on the light side. The ultra cheap and yet useful notification led is gone, Sony did not even wait to introduce a LTPO display... just gone for no good reason.Now, let's discuss instead about what when really wrong with this phone in all honesty and why it is not worth buying: the display, the competition and the price.- about the display, there is no other way of putting it: it's bad. Except for HDR and the 120Hz refresh, it's the same panel you can find on the much much cheaper Xperia 10 V, and even worse with respect to not only the previous 5s but also 10s when it comes to viewing angles. Sony talks about colour accuracy but it is absolutely impossible to see any consistent white, due to the rainbow effect, without moving the device a meter away. Put this Xperia 5 V next to similarly priced Samsung and Apple products and you will realize how bad this display is, it really belongs to a budget smartphone. Absolutely unacceptable.- despite being a unique phone, the competition is not lacking at this price point, both by Samsung & Apple but also some chinese brands. However there is another competitor, that is, the Xperia 1 V. Because for a "little" more money and basically no extra weight you get a great display (instead), twice the storage, more RAM, an extra camera and a more refined frame. Yes, it's bigger but not by much, for some people may be a negligible difference, if you can afford it. In other words, the 1 V is a better value, putting this 5 V in a not so good position.- In short, the value/price ratio is quite bad: either the quality should be higher or the price lower. Effectively it's a downgraded phone with respect to the Xperia 5 IV (which could still be okay) but with a higher street price. For this price the display should have stayed the same, at the very least. Or with the same mediocre display but a much cheaper price. The Xperia 1 is (too) expensive, but at least it is very good! The Xperia 10 is disappointing, but at least it's cheap! This one happens to be disappointing and expensive. It makes no sense.Bottom line, don't buy, it's really not worth it, unless it gets a big price cut. But even then, can you live with the ugliness of this display?

title: Sony Xperia 5 V â€“ Black - 6.1â€ 21:9 HDR OLED 120Hz - Triple Focal Length (with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS) - 3.5mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 8GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM

title: Sony Xperia 5 V â€“ Black - 6.1â€ 21:9 HDR OLED 120Hz - Triple Focal Length (with Next Gen Sensor & ZEISS) - 3.5mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 8GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM
review_title: This is a premium smart phone
review_text: This is Brilliant the box is basic but clean and well presentedThere's no charger or headphones included but most flagship devices do this now its common practiceThe phone is 6.1 display and a very well made phone it feels very premium in the hand and the material used feels high quality it's a metal construction with 2 rear cameras and a front camera the screen is very bright and vibrant the buttons feel satisfying to press and the fingerprint ID panel is on the right hand sideIt's very responsive and fast to use and overall has a nice user interfaceIt's a real high quality phoneThere's a few excellent features it can take duel nano sim cards or you can set up a digital sim card it installs all your basic apps on start up but you can turn some off if you don't use themSome of the apps include YouTube ,Amazon, Google services, Sony Bravia app, etcThat is also another great feature if you have a Sony TV or PlayStation you can connect your phone to themVolume is good in calls or music and movies all very goodthe audio and sounds in general is high end even device soundsIt's snapdragon chip with 128gb rom 8gb ram which makes it super fast in everything from video to app use its almost instant with everything it does.has a lovely black finish and just looks and feels very good quality battery life seems OK it's a good size in my opinion the photos are excellent some of the best iv seen video is also excellent with next generation ziess cameraI was very pleased to see a 3.5 mm headphone jack too so headphones are no problemI think it's fairly priced at the time of writing this especiallyfor this type of premium device with these specsHighly recommended

title: Sony Xperia L4 - 6.2" 21:9 Wide display | Triple lens camera (Single Sim) - Black
review_text: This is a budget phone if its compared to the x1 or x5 it's never going to win. But it does its job well. The L4 is in the same 21:9 style as the other sony xperia phones. The screen is big and watching tv/films/entertainment, is what it's designed for. The sound isn't great its not stereo, so I would recommend head phones it does have a 3.5mm jack. Finger print scanner works 4/5 times. The screen is not the most responsive vs the high end phones but nothing that really hold you back or that I found frustrating. I do like the Sony features, I.E you can srink the screen to the bottom corner for easy one handed use and a double tap on the middle side bar brings up an adjustable settings menu.For the money I would highly recommend but just remember it is a budget phone.

title: Sony Xperia L4 - 6.2" 21:9 Wide display | Triple lens camera (Single Sim) - Black
review_text: Within less than a month the phone keeps freezing.  From what I can see, no other apps or programmes are running in the background, it just simply freezes.  I have to lock & unlock the phone to regain any ability to type, even then it still freezes while entering the pin code.  Not just typing, even when scrolling through Instagram and websites the phone will freeze.The fingerprint recognition rarely wants to work.  And for a left handed person (it may be the same for a right handed person), the fingerpad is positioned poorly, if any part of your hand touches the pad it starts vibrating the phone and showing failed to recognise alerts.  In the end I switched this option off because no matter how I held the phone, my hand would inevitably touch the pad and vibrate.I was told by customer support to do a soft reset, this did nothing to help.* 1 week later *The screen fell out of the phone casing, only held together by a wire.This actually temporarily helped the screen sensitivity, and I regained the ability to text/use the screen.* 2 weeks later *Lost the screen functions again.  And the screen does its own thing now.  Opening apps, scrolling and types at random without me even touching the screen.The phone has also stopped charging.  Sometimes it will charge if I turn it off/on.To sum up, this was a rather disappointing purchase, espeically as I have been using Xperia's for over 10yrs now.  I'm curious to know what will go wrong next.

title: Sony Xperia L4 - 6.2" 21:9 Wide display | Triple lens camera (Single Sim) - Black
review_text: Good price, nice pictures.

title: Sony Xperia L4 - 6.2" 21:9 Wide display | Triple lens camera (Single Sim) - Black
review_text: I like the feel in my hand, I have large hands and this phone is definitely a one handed phone for me. The feel and look of the phone are good too. IT HAS A HEADPHONE JACK!!! Something I have missed with recent phones.However...This phones Contacts, messages, calendar, pictures, video, phone calls, personal data and everything else is run by Google. It's as if Sony made rhis phone and handed over to google to make the apps for it, theres no sony apps on this appart from store sub apps. If you don't have a problem with this then it's fine, if you are like me in that you want to only use Google maps and play store only, then this phone definitely isn't for you.Now for the only hardware issue I found. The lag is pretty horrendous, you need patience when using this phone. For example, this morning I went on argos to look for a new phone as selling this one. I dared click on filter on Argos, I ticked the box for a price range, waited 7 seconds, then dare clicked on a second price range, the first tick disappeared, the page froze, I pressed back and nothing happened, closed the page then re opened, it opened with no ticks on filter lol. I used my wife's galaxy A33 to do the same thing, it worked instantly. You have been warned :)

title: Sony Xperia L4 - 6.2" 21:9 Wide display | Triple lens camera (Single Sim) - Black
review_text: I have always liked my Sony Xperia till it got smashed up. But since I brought this replacement it's just like the old days. I missed having a Sony Xperia and I'm glad I found this one.

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_title: A JOY TO FINALLY UPGRADE MY PHONE WOO HOO SONY
review_text: Having had my original iPhone for 10+ years now yes you heard right 10+ years now,I thought it was about time I was due to treat myself to an upgrade phone,was a little worried of the change if I'm totally honest due to having so much on my original iphone,but the Sony xperia L3 made it very simple for me to do so and considering how long it has been owning my iPhone with a lot of info and pics to transfer across to my new phone.real die hard iPhone people will never be satisfied with anything but an iPhone,but don't pay no attention to those reviews,a new device will always require a certain amount of getting used to wether you like it or now and I can honestly say,this phone is such a big breath of fresh air for me.so much quicker and is very quick to do what you need it to do as well,battery life is very impressive as well with a huge 3300mah of staying power,you can also have it on battery + mode which allows battery to last even longer,how crazy is that,wowzers is all I can say to that,i am overall very impressed with my Sony xperia L3 purchase and I would be brave enough to say it's every bit as good as an iPhone X,my brother having recently purchased 1 and my phone also better in places,battery capacity size and very similar screen overall size as well.I found the security fingerprint scanner to be pretty impressive as well,working alot more often than not,again ignore those other reviews.OVERALL THIS PHONE/DEVICE IS WORTH EVERY PENNY OF ITS PRICE AND LOOKS A MORE PRICEY UNIT AS WELL,DOES NOT FEEL LIKE A LOW COST UNIT. IF LIKE ME YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A NEW PHONE UPGRADE,THEN DONT ALWAYS MUG YOURSELF OFF BY GOING FOR AN OVERPRICED UNIT. WHY OW WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT ?AWESOME SPEEDY AND IMPRESSIVE PHONE AND STYLISH TOO.BUY IT NOW AND SAVE YOURSELF A DECENT AMOUNT OF CASH.  ;-)

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: Have used this model for years it was a charging issue since resolved that prompted thiss purchase. I don't crave anything fancy, just a badic phone for calls and messages. However, I have loads of apps which run perfectly.

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: Overall for 180 euros, the phone is really good. I have a lot of apps on it and the phone didn't slow down at all but the only thing that I have an issue with is that its only 720p. When you're watching youtube there will be black bars and 720p isn't really that great but it will do. The fingerprint scanner is ok most of the time I need to tap it twice for it to work but i use the smart lock face unlock feature most of the time. The battery life is really good because I finish the day most of the time with 20% but if you don't use snapchat then the battery would last you for even 2 days. I would definitely recommend a case and screen protector but you need to be careful what screen protector you use because some screen protectors won't let you press the side of the phone, for example, the backspace. The camera is good it won't turn you into a photographer but you can take good quality photos. Other features that people might care about are it has NFC it has a 3.5m headphone jack  you can go to the quick settings and cast ur screen to a chromecast.

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: Very disappointed. All seemed ok when first turned on and then it just went dead. Wouldnâ€™t charge, wouldnâ€™t turn on, nothing. After trying everything on the troubleshooting list I contacted Amazon for a refund. Wouldnâ€™t ever buy a phone from Amazon again now.

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: Been with Sony for a number of years now and needed a new phone to replace my very sad and broken XA I'd had twice in a row that was from maybe 2016. This bad boy came through in the new year and I love it to pieces, the performance is great and at first I wasn't sure if this was a refurbished phone because the box and manual looked a bit different, but the phone itself is legitimate and very good. The battery life is chunky too, even at thirty percent it lasts a good while if you look after it well!

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: Not impressed at all !!Looks great and good displayHowever it keeps dropping the mobile connection which comes back after a reboot but drops again after a minute or 2....This was a present so I'm not impressed whatsoever !!Returned and bought a Samsung instead......

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: I'm not the biggest techhead but purchased this namely to make calls and use a few apps to see if I can ditch the iPhone and use some phones with more functionality that don't costs the earth. This seems ok, has a habit every now and again of pausing or staying on one screen but I wholeheartedly believe this is due to processor speed and me not wanting the best or the quickest. This is sturdy, robust, battery life is acceptable and does what I need it to.

title: Sony Xperia L2 5.7 Inch 18:9 Full HD+ display Android 8 UK SIM-Free Smartphone with 3GB RAM and 32GB Storage â€“ Black
review_text: For a fraction of the price of flagship phones, you get a large clear screen, very good battery life, a headphone jack, SD card support to 512GB, little software bloat, and all the features you'd expect from Android. The camera's fine (although not as good as you'd get from flagship devices) , and gamers might struggle with graphic-intensive titles, but for most day-to-day purposes it's a terrific phone for the money!

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_title: Good quality phone with nice looks
review_text: I had an Xperia Z5 for 3 years, sadly the battery was getting weak so I had decided to upgrade. I like Android's OS and started looking at my options. Most of the phones were quite expensive and didn't offer me more for the asking price. XZ2 was an obvious choice considering that the price was around Â£300. It feels a little heavier than Z5 but feels sleek. The camera is good and has a lot of different functionalities. At first, it might seem like Pixel or iPhone cameras are easier to use and produce better images. However, Sony offers you more settings which are great once you know how to use them, plus better low light images and a much better resolution with 19 megapixels. I like the fact you can customise your home screen with different themes, colours, grid layout and widgets. Another useful feature is the single hand mode. All of those features are very limited on some Android devices that I have used as well. If you are looking for a stylish phone, that does not cost like a laptop (Â£800+), I would definitely recommend. Plenty of useful functionalities at a good price. Anything else that might seem better, cost an extra Â£200-400 which is almost another phone.

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_title: Good size and quality for the price.
review_text: I bought this as an upgrade from my Sony â˜“.I purchased it  as an amazon warehouse deal. Condition "as new"It certainly came packaged as new. All accessories still in bags, phone still wrapped in plastic.I'm not sure how long it's been hanging around in the warehouse for, as it needed 13 individual software UPDATES!! Taking just under 7 HOURS to complete!I almost lost the will to live!But, having said that. I'm, glad I persevered.The battery life is excellent. I can get 2 full days use.The camera is good. Nothing fantastic, but does the job. I like the fact it has a quick camera button on the side, so you don't have to unlock the phone first.It basically does everything my old Sony x did. Just better and faster.It also not too big, so still fits in your pocket or slot in your handbag.I do recommend buying a cover for it. It is very shiny and slippery in your hand.Overall a great mid priced phone, with lots of good features.

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_title: Quality phone at reasonable price with brilliant performance.
review_text: This is my everyday phone.  I love it.  Very fast, lots of storage, wifi and bluetooth connections are pretty instant.  Battery life is great - with heavy use only needs charge every few days.  The screen quality is excellent with deep blacks and shadows, and the adaptive brightness works very well even in bright sunshine.  Screen mirroring is quick and efficient.  If you don't want to fork out the money on the very latest model, but want a quality phone definitely consider the xz2.

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_text: Phone stopped working after 4 days this is my second phone the first phone speaker broke but my husband wanted to replace this with the same phone so bought another transferred all data across and now this one will not turn on and we cannot get any of his data.  I would avoid buying any of these Sony XZ2 phones from Amazon

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_text: Really happy with this phone. Have had Apple phones for the last few years but wanted to move away and I couldn't be happier. This feels like a really premium phone such as a Galaxy S10 (which funnily enough my Husband has and prefers the Sony) The camera doesn't have as much functionality as some more expensive phones but if you just want good quality photos without any fuss then this is great!

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_text: It would be a decent phone if it was about 50-100 pounds cheaper. In the year and a half I've had it, it was worked fairly well although it will randomly crash for no reason. The screen also completely died for no reason and although it was covered by the warranty, Sony customer support in Ireland still charged me a 15 euro handling fee. Is now an average phone at best

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_text: Screen good size picture quality and sound good

title: Sony Xperia XZ2 UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Liquid Black [UK]
review_text: After going back to Sony after years with Samsung, coming from an S5, the fingerprint scanner is very good works pretty much every time unless finger wet or gressy, the software is fast and responsive and I like the built in assistant, the screen is fabulous to look at, am happy with my purchase, highly recommended

title: Sony Xperia XA2 32 GB Android O UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: Firstly this is a genuine review! I always do lots of research and the Xperia was on a short list of 2. I've  had this phone a couple of months now and I'm glad I opted for the Xperia XA2. There are two versions of the XA2 - one with an enormous screen and the one I have which has a 5.2 inch screen so it fits a female hand very well. The phone is very tactile but is quite slippery - the addition of a cheap silicon case has solved the problem and gives protection in day to day use. The camera is fab but then this is a Sony phone so it should be. A really great thing about this phone is that you can easily uninstall many of the pre-loaded apps (unlike phones I've previously had) that you don't want and it's easy to install apps you do want. You can add extra storage up to 128Gb so I have a 64 Gb micro SD card for music and photos. The phone connects easily to a PC with the supplied cable making it a doddle to transfer photos and music both ways. The phone "talks" to my Panasonic camera with out a fuss using Panasonic's image app meaning I can view photos taken on the camera, transfer them to the phone for emailing etc and the phone can also be a remote control. The phone is very fast and has plenty of RAM. All in all I think this is an excellent reasonably priced phone at the Â£199 I paid for it (have seen it at Â£250 in a well known phone shop) which does everything I want it to do.

title: Sony Xperia XA2 32 GB Android O UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: Brilliant phone for the price. Its looks are very appealing, with a great display (especially when vivid mode is on). It's very responsive and smooth, with more than capable performance in more intense apps. The camera is amazing and to be quite honest it's every bit as good as my Google Pixel's camera, with 60FPS 1080p video recording (though personally I find 30FPS 4K to look nicer). Selfie camera is serviceable with a very wide lens. While it only has a single downward firing speaker, it's fairly loud and surprisingly high quality - certainly not too tinny at all. The battery is also superb! With light to moderate usage you can seriously squeeze two or three days out of it between charges, which is conveniently done through USB-C.On the software side it comes with a lot of Sony apps, some useful but unfortunately a lot are pure bloatware. It comes preloaded with AVG anti-virus which for some reason cannot be uninstalled, though its functionality can be heavily reduced to the point of it not mattering.The only other issue I can really think of is the lack of ambient display, but that's not a big deal at all, especially given the price.This is a fantastic phone that has served me very well so far. Never making the mistake of buying a top-of-the-line flagship again!

title: Sony Xperia XA2 32 GB Android O UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: Returning this phone because, when used with the official Sony case, there is interference on the mic, distorting my voice into a series of 'buzz' noises. Ridiculous! A fault in my handset or the build in general? Mic self-test fails when in the case but not when out of it. Simple voice recorder records 'buzz' noises in the case but records fine out of the case.Bluetooth audio is awful - stutters in situations where previous handsets have been flawless with the same speaker. This is without changing any settings.Touchscreen often doesn't recognise my fingers (maybe I need new fingers). I have particular problems on the edge of the screen, but maybe I would adapt to that with more use.Also, don't buy the phone expecting to use it right away - I think it did about 10 updates and needed a total of 5gb of data, and you have to confirm a restart prompt after each update, so you can't even leave it overnight to do it all.Apart from those problems, I like the phone. The design is attractive (what you might expect from Sony), and there's not too much bloatware. The launcher is ok - you can sort the app drawer but you can't get rid of the stupid message count badges.

title: Sony Xperia XA2 32 GB Android O UK SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_title: Very good phone for the price paid.
review_text: My wife needed a new mobile phone as her current one was lasting less and less before it needed recharging, plus it had only 8gb of memory, which was causing space issues every time the OS or apps needed upgrading. I having just replaced my mobile phone and bought a Sony XZ1, thought the Sony XA2 looked good for what she wanted, which was to send text messages, make the odd phone call and occasionally take pictures. She wasn't really interested in all sorts of bells and whistles, nor playing games, so this looked perfect. Had it for a couple of weeks now, and it is performing as expected, is a lot quicker than her previous phone, takes far better pictures and is generally a much much better phone. As she has only had it a short time, there is nothing much to say about it other than the fact that when typing SMS messages (and like my Sony XZ1) it is very sensitive and just putting your fingers close to the screen without actually touching it,  can end with unwanted characters appearing within your text. Overall she is very happy with it, and it is certainly a marked improvement on her previous phone. It is a Sony, so has a nice solid feel to it with a bit of weight, unlike some of the other largely lightweight flimsy plastic brands out there. I was lucky in that I saw it on offer in the amazon 48 hour sale, and got it for less than one hundred and thirty five pounds, whereas another well known retailer recently taken over by Sainsbury, had it listed at over two hundred and fifty pounds at one stage straight after I had ordered this one!

title: Sony Xperia 10 V 5G Dual 8GB RAM 128 GB- Black UK Version
review_text: Arrived quickly and as described

title: Sony Xperia 10 V 5G Dual 8GB RAM 128 GB- Black UK Version
review_text: Ordered Wednesday, arrived 2.00pm Thursday.My first non-flagship phone. Not as zippy as previous Experia Z1, Z5 compact, LG G6 or G8thinq.No AOD so no clock when screen off. Camera has a 2 second delay after you've pressed the button. Volume doesn't work when I listen thru my earphones, have to change volume on phone.Having said all that I knew this when I ordered it. That's why I ordered the 8gb ram version and paid Â£330, (it's cheaper on some of the dodgy online shops)not Â£800 -Â£1200 and more for the current flagships.Very happy with delivery. Phone performs exactly as I expected or even better!Screen quality is excellent, even with the ageing processor. Sound quality is very good thru the speakers, and excellent thru earphones. I am able to pick out sounds I've never noticed before.Pictures are noticably better than my previous couple of flagships especially night shots. Videos are more than exceptable. Battery is crazy!I charged it yesterday, now 6pm the next day and still has 1 day and 21 hours left!Predictive text (like previous Sony's) is excellent and invariably gets the words right, even when I'm being silly! The shouting matches I've had with the LG's!!! Getting faster speeds with mobile Internet, so internal antenna is better!All in all, happy with the phone for the amount I paid...hope it lasts!

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Sage Green - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_text: Nice phone, good size. Only a day old but good so far. Set Up straight forward, data transfer quite easy. The new phone is supplied as phone only, no lead or charger, bit of a shame for a phone of this price. Screen quality very good . Have not used the camera yet.

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Sage Green - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1
review_title: Average phone, great battery poor performance
review_text: I bought this phone as I liked the claimed battery life length. I have to say, they weren't lying, the battery is great. With small top-up charges in the car on the way to work, I may not need to do a full charge for over a week. Also, it was very easy to set up, super intuitive.However, there are some major down sides. The camera, for both pics and vids, is distinctly average, with audio recording easily distorted at high volumes (IE concerts). Several game apps run quite slowly as do apps using biometrics. There is a weird 10 second delay when you wake up the phone using the fingerprint sensor where you can't use the navigation controls at the bottom, the pull down menu from the top or turn the phone off again until the navigation icons reappear.For its battery life and ease if use the phone is great but is let down by laggy performance and poor camera.

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Sage Green - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1

title: Sony Xperia 10 V Sage Green - 6.1 Inch 21:9 Wide OLED - Triple lens - Lightweight & Compact - 3.5 mm audio jack - Android 13 - SIM free - 6GB RAM - 128GB Storage - IP65/68 rating - Dual SIM hybrid *1

title: Sony Xperia XA1 SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_title: Flagship performance at mid range prices
review_text: I brought this phone for my uncle after been issued one of these as a company phone and using it for some time. My current  personal phone i use is a Sony xz ,which i have had since November 2016, and my wife has a xz premium so i have few comparisons that can be made. For the price the xa1 is good value , its has almost flagship specifications at mid range prices.DesignIts thin edge to edge screen and 5 inch screen makes the phone look very thin and tall, its not as wide as my xz but you can hold this phone with 1 hand use. The build quality is excellent seems solid and looks almost the same as the more expensive xperia.displayThe screen is very bright the colors are vivid,Evan tho the resolution is only 720 you cant really tell unless you really look hard. The brightness of LCD really helps and the phone has a IPS LCD this helps with them viewing angles not fading. Im very impressed with the display compared to my full HD xz.PerformanceThe phone is quick and snappy , its good that sony beefed up the ram to 3gb and are using the latest helios p20 quadcore chipset, there was no noticeable lag when playing games or multitasking.CameraThe camera sensor is the same one as the xz, so picture quality is good, the camera is fast, from launch to picture it does under a second. It has manual  modes and front camera is also good, but i would say my xz still edges it in camera.BatteryBattery last me  for a full day , but you can easy get 2 days if you put on stamina mode on. It also has battery care function, this will only charge your phone when needed and at slower currents, thus extending your battery lifespan.This phone also uses the new USB-C charging cable, now you can put the charging cable anyway without breaking the USB port on your phone.It also charges quicker and transfers data 10x faster.ConclusionI think this phone is brilliant it looks stunning ,gives you top specifications, decent camera  and a good display for Â£229, for most people this phone is all you need, i myself have the more expensive xz , yes the xz is better has better processor and camera ,but your paying Â£200 more. For most people this phone will do everything you need and save you money.

title: Sony Xperia XA1 SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_title: AVOID:  screen has well-documented response problems that you can test for yourself on a display model
review_text: As mentioned elsewhere in at least one review (that I missed when ordering this phone), it's not possible to have BlueTooth and Wi-Fi working at the same time without a host of problems.  This issue is well-documented on Sony's own forums (search for "sony xa1 bluetooth wifi problem"), and there's no resolution being offered that I can find.The "answer" is to switch off Wi-Fi when using BlueTooth (not great for streaming music from the internet!) and switch off BlueTooth when using Wi-Fi (not great for convenience when getting into the car or wanting your fitness tracker to sync).  When things do lock up, toggling Airplane Mode on & off typically provides a period of stability.Another deal-breaker should be the intrusive bloatware, particularly the "What's New" app, that allows your mobile network to push crap to your SIM-free device(!), and which Sony does not allow you to permanently get rid of.  To be fair, I've used an Xperia before and was familiar with Sony's bent for pushing apps on you that you are unable to set the phone to permanently ignore; however, allowing a carrier to infest a phone that was not bought from them is a step way too far.It should be pointed out that the phone itself is great - the screen is a good size, and it's pin-sharp; the camera works really well, and the whole device is snappy and responsive.  I'm actually keeping it, having invested a lot of time in setting it up and working out how to live with it, plus the additional money I've spent on a device-specific case and new charging cables.Overall:  this phone can NOT be recommended due to the BlueTooth-related flaws which Sony has been well-aware of and is refusing to publicly acknowledge.UPDATE (March 2018):The Wi-Fi/BlueTooth connectivity problems have been remedied through a firmware update that arrived in February; however, the responsive of the screen has degraded significantly.For example, I unlock the phone using the "Pattern", which requires a swipe from dot-to-dot-to-dot - this is frustratingly difficult to carry out, because the screen loses "connection" to my finger mid-pattern, necessitating multiple attempts nearly every time I pick up the phone.As another example, I use "gesture typing", where text is input by keeping the finger on the keyboard and spelling out words by swiping - again, the phone thinks the finger is being listed and usually types two or three short words in place of the intended word.Another problem with the screen that's become apparent is the edges don't register touch 99% of the time; this means the notification shade can't be pulled down from the top of the screen.  The area of the screen where I first noticed this is the right-hand edge, when I realised that trying to use the Backspace ("delete") key wasn't working.  I've been into two phone shops and verified that their display models have the exact same problem by going into the in-built drawing app and trying to fill a blank canvas with colour - you're left with neatly-defined strips of white along each edge of the screen.I'm going to start the (probably fruitless) process of returning this device that I've had for two frustrating months.  Despite the phone's great camera, snappy performance, and sound-feeling build quality, I'm completely turned off Sony products now, particularly given the time I've lost in trying to get this device to work and the money I've lost on buying a case and new charging cables.

title: Sony Xperia XA1 SIM-Free Smartphone - Black
review_text: A very decent phone for the money, but do be prepared for endless or so it felt updates to software.There is nothing wrong just keep accepting them, I suggest turning off mobile data for the first days you have the phone until the updates are done.Sony does its updates one by one which means if there have been 10 since your phone left the factory you will update 10 times. However after day one the updates have stopped and phone is very user friendly now.The camera is superb says 23meg pixel but my phone said 20, still great pictures and film as well.Like the fact it comes with AVG to protect the phone.The start up compared to my old phone is virtually instant from being turned off.All in all a decent amount of features good ram 3 meg and good internal memory in around 300, which can be expanded with an SD card. Note there is no Finger print reader not sure why it is shown as a feature.OK not in I phone territory but at Â£131 is a fraction of the prices Apple charge.
