review_text: Very good phone for this price.

title: OnePlus 8T 5G 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with Quad Camera, 65W Warp Charge and Dual SIM - Aquamarine Green - 2 Year Warranty (Renewed)
review_title: Worst camera of this price range
review_text: Camera is so bad that I will never buy another oneplus again. This one was my third. I am done with this brand. The camera definition is bad, and also the colors, and details. Never again OnePlus

title: OnePlus 10 Pro 5G (UK) 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with 2nd Gen Hasselblad Camera for Mobile - Emerald Forest [UK version]
review_text: Having used pretty much every generation of OnePlus in past and being accustomed to the UI and quality standards I would say this one doesn't disappoint. Don't listen to the biased reviewers, decided to go for this one after giving Pixel 6 a try for a few months and it was like a breath of fresh air. 80w charging is something you can't overlook, especially since you get the actual charging brick in the box,plus a free case and a preinstalled screen protector. OnePlus have stuck to their super thin and light design, great built quality and the exterior is amazing (granted the camera module design is an acquired taste) no complaints there, at least from me. The phone looks super premium, fingerprint works flawlessly, God I missed that, especially whilst having been stuck with the pixel... Camera quality is up there, hardly the best but definitely not mediocre. 10bit shots can come up with some insane results, more than enough for the average every day user. The display is just out of this world, resolution is great, refresh rate I'd say matches the performance of my recently departed 8T. Battery life would vary, on a heavy duty day, I'd be at about 20% around 8pm-ish so can easily stretch to a full day depending on usage, mind you the super fast charging more than makes up for that. If you come from an earlier OnePlus, then the new incarnation of the oxygen os would be a bit of a disappointment but still dominating most of the alternatives on the market. Generally speaking if you're looking for that established OnePlus experience you can't go wrong, despite the relatively higher price point, I believe it's still more than worth it if you're considering OnePlus.

title: OnePlus 10 Pro 5G (UK) 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with 2nd Gen Hasselblad Camera for Mobile - Emerald Forest [UK version]
review_text: After having my Samsung s10+ for many years the lure of a new phone was on my mind. After some careful research I stumbled across the OnePlus 10 pro. Looking into many of the specifications that the new flagship devices had to offer I was surprised that my older Samsung still had many cutting edge features like screen resolution and storage capacity. So I was initially drawn to the s22 ultra, but seeing this in the flesh just reminded me of a note device, and those corners will ruin a decent pair of jeans. The s22 had inferior specs to my nearly 4 year old s10 + so that was a downgrade and wasn't prepared to pay for that. Now onto the OnePlus 10 pro, this has a superior chipset, screen, ram and looks so smart. The software is lightning fast and is super slick. This is the first time I have dieviated away from Samsung in decades but the oxygen software is a breeze. The charging with 80watts is nothing like I've ever experienced before, and even the wireless 50watts is faster than many wired devices today. The technology that OnePlus are delivering to their customers is fantastic. The camera is co developed by hassleblad and is amazing, it actually makes a wide lense usable instead of a gimic. Delivery was next day, set up was a breeze. I would highly recommend, and you get a pair of wireless, headphones... but only if you order quick!

title: OnePlus 10 Pro 5G (UK) 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with 2nd Gen Hasselblad Camera for Mobile - Emerald Forest [UK version]
review_text: Fast UI ,great screen, Fast charging,Camera WOW,really  like oxygen, phone is fast and responsive this is the fist Oneplus I have had the wife has had one for 2 years and that impressed me, have had Samsung previously,  but would say this is on different  level can,t really find anything negative to say about this phone

title: OnePlus 10 Pro 5G (UK) 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with 2nd Gen Hasselblad Camera for Mobile - Emerald Forest [UK version]
review_text: I bought this in July 2022, I write this review in November 2023. I am still really happy with this phone. the battery still lasts all day, with really fast charging within half an hour I have plenty to get me through the day with light browsing and some gaming. The screen still look really good and the camera is as snappy and fast as ever. really lowlight shots are a little bit of an issue with noise in darker areas. But as these phones constantly get compared to phones double the price, if that is my only problem with the phone, I can live with that. I don't need to re buy this phone but it does make me want to keep an eye on what OnePlus does in the future.

title: OnePlus 10 Pro 5G (UK) 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with 2nd Gen Hasselblad Camera for Mobile - Emerald Forest [UK version]
review_text: I got this phone when it was just Â£535,what a bargain.Crisp, bright, fast and fluid screen.Great, versatile cameras.Highly recommended

title: OnePlus 10 Pro 5G (UK) 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with 2nd Gen Hasselblad Camera for Mobile - Emerald Forest [UK version]
review_title: Thought it'd be a great experience but it's just fine
review_text: I've had a few Oneplus and have kept loyal to the brand, thought that this one would probably be the best of all I've had, and it's turned out to be, let's say a lot less of what I was expecting. I've had it for few months and think that if you're a gamer maybe this is your phone, but if you care about camera, weight, bulkiness, and finish maybe look somewhere else.CAMERA I don't understand why you would brag about the camera when it's so bad. Even after the latest update at the end of June 2022, pictures are massively overexposed, tone and saturation are bad as well. I like photography, and thought I could live with average pictures, but now I find myself editing pictures a lot because they are way out of line. Don't buy it if you care about the pictures and videos.SCREEN is beautiful, video quality is superb. But If this is your flagship phone and you're putting a premium screen, at least stick the screen protector professionally, the screen protector from factory is awful, I think they stuck mine dirty or there was something wrong with it, but you can see it's not well done. I've been using the phone for a few months now and the screen protector needs changing already, with just normal use.FACE RECOGNITION is not good compared to my wife's iPhone, and I'm not an iPhone fan at all.CHARGER IS MASSIVE but it does a great job, not the best for traveling though. Battery life is just fine, if you want it to last you'll have to deactivate all the good stuff.VERY HEAVY piece of work, you can feel it after handling it for long periods.SOUND is really good, the dolby atmos does the job great and the speakers are good.HEADPHONES' sound is good and nice premium finish, but they are bulky and bother me after long time use, mics are rubbish always have problems during phonecalls, can't control the volume which is a massive downside for me. If you don't get them for free don't buy them, not worth the money.LONG STORY SHORT, I'd probably buy another brand if I could choose again, even if I'm a fan of the brand.

title: OnePlus Nord CE 3 Lite 5G, 8GB RAM 128GB Storage Chromatic Grey EU
review_text: Phone arrived in perfect quality and before earliest estimated delivery day.I ordered EU but meant UK so ordered the wrong charger.

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: After finally converting to Android from an iPhone user, I'm over the moon with the one plus 6t.Super fast operation, crystal clear and vibrant screen, amazing camera, amazing battery life, super fast charging and it comes with a pre-installed screen protector and a case in the box.The in screen finger print reader works well, but can have trouble at times if the screen is dirty, or your finger is just slightly out of place. But still works well and is great for in app security such as internet banking.Facial recognition is brilliant and what I use most to unlock the phone. I just wish I could use it for in app security instead of the dinner print scanner.For the price, this phone is an absolute beast that shows your how over priced all the other flag ship phones are such as iPhone or Samsung's.One plus also has a brilliant community that the developers listen to and communicate with regularly.Super happy with my purchase and would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a cheaper but more powerful phone

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: Very pleased with overall performance. Battery life better than expected when on standby (at least 2 days) and is acceptable when under heavy use (streaming video from Prime). However, as most videos and films are viewed in landscape mode, it would be nice to have a speaker at each end for stereo effect. Current single speaker OK but not spectacular. Lack of a 3.5mm socket is unfortunate, but Bluetooth works OK, and the phone is less liable to water ingress. Small notch works well for the front camera and really isn't intrusive, unlike some notches. Included flexible protective cover a useful addition but certainly isn't finger print resistant! In general a very nice phone which feels right in the hand, is good to look at, is great to use and represents value for money. Would bye it all over again!

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: Having used iPhones for nearly ten years, I was nervous about leaving Apple. What do I miss after two weeks with a 6T? Maybe the fonts when texting.The great: the battery lasts two days with moderate usage, the screen is huge and rather awesome, it's fast, and it feels nice in the hand. The good: the Android OS is getting close to the Apple's in ease of use and design (yes, iOS is superior but isnt worth the considerable extra spend). The camera is good, pretty much what you'd expect for the mid-range price.The bad? A couple of tiny niggles with the UX maybe (i.e. you can't swipe to go back on Chrome)  but it's hard to find fault.A great phone, at a great price.

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: Had the phone for 11 month now.Pros:A good phone with all apps functioning well, features work well, facial recognition, fingerprint etc.Quick access memory and use.Good mobile office.Con:Battery.  After 10 months battery heats up (very hot) and drains rapidly.  Has to remain on charge to survive the day.  This is hopeless when you are working away from your desk/car.  I have now started turning the phone off completely to make sure I have enough power when needed.

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: This is a great flagship phone and I've found the switch from Apple to Android quite refreshing.The camera is better than the internet would lead you to believe and stood it's ground against an iPhone X in low light conditions recently.I bought the OnePlus 6t primarily for its video stabilisation and 4k 60fps and I've been generally pleased. Footage can be a bit choppy when panning and the stabilisation can produce small jumps if you are not super smooth with your movements but it's as good if not better than the Pixel 2 and Galaxy 9 I tried for general video work.Dash charge is great, the things well built, battery life is up to two days so my only beef is with the curved screen which makes it nigh on impossible to get a screen protector to work.I opted for the official OnePlus 6t protector and its still not perfect with lift in the corners and a stange speckled pattern emerging after a few days near the top of the screen.I know this is a problem with almost all phones now but it really is irritating!Anyhow, it's decent phone at a decent price and a pleasing replacement to my venerable iPhone 6s.

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: I've had a lot of phones, and this is by far the best. Well built, fast and reliable. The speed is just crazy - what would you expect with 8 gigs of MEM. And I don't think I will ever fully fill up the 256 space. Love how it is completely customizable, making it look unique and personal. It's also middle of the range. A little bigger than my S9, but not as big as my Note 8. Perfect size to hold.

title: OnePlus 6T 8 GB RAM 256 GB SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black (2 Year Manufacturer Warranty)
review_text: Coming from the 3T, the 6T has exceeded my expectations. It's much nicer and is very slick - that display. The fingerprint reader is a talking point and it's not as reliable or quick as on the 3T. It doesn't bother me and I'm living happily with it. The ebony wood bumper case I got compliments it really well. A transparent case does come with the phone which I didn't know about.I don't usual pay much attention to a device's speed and responsiveness when it's new. The real test is after six months of use which is when you know how good it is. So far, Android hasn't faired as well as the other device - maybe Pie will change my mind.Battery life has been excellent and after moderate to heavy use, I still get about 20-30% of battery life left from a single charge. Though I notice the app management is VERY aggressive killing off apps before you can blink! What's the 8GB of RAM for? It's irritating but not a showstopper.I haven't missed the audio jack at all but then again, I got myself a bluetooth headphone. The problem I find with the phone is I often can't quickly tell which side is up. You have to look for the front-facing camera and with the all black display it's not so obvious. Speaking of cameras, it gets the job done and I've received compliments of its pictures from folks with the other device. Maybe they were impressed or they had such low expectations to begin with....After the Desire, S2, One M8 and 3T, the 6T is a great upgrade and I would highly recommend it.

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_title: Best bang for buck phone at its price point, albeit a few small troubles
review_text: Bought this during OnePlus's big sale they've had early January, I've used it for about a week or so, spent a good bit of time working out what I wanted changing and tuning everything to my preferences, I'll just say at the start that this is a genuinely great phone and I think it should even be considered against the flagship models from the likes of Apple, Google and Samsung, it's genuinely that good, I wouldn't normally write reviews but I found a few things of note with this phone that really weren't mentioned anywhere else that I think potential buyers should know, I'll jam those in after a general pros and cons deal, so here goes.Pros:Speed - I'll just be blunt here, this phone is fast, animations are minimal and everything is geared to let you go where you want to go as fast as possible, it's all very intuitive as you'd expect, the unlock features (which will be addressed in a bit) are competitive with flagship phones and even better in some instances, it's a truly great experience.Methods of unlock - Wow. The facial ID and finger scanner are some of the best on the market on this phone, quick, snappy and they just work, both integrate with a few apps here and there and unlocking the phone is a breeze, I debate on just how secure the facial ID is but the finger scanner is top notch for its pricing.Design and style - Build quality on this is great, the weight is nice and it feels well assembled, the glass backing doesn't feel fragile in any way and the overall phone has a nice look (minus the notch, but thats a personal taste and can be more or less made invisible in the settings)Features - All in all, a lot of the features crammed in here just work really well, being able to swipe directions to pause and skip songs with the screen still off is great, and theres more like those buried in the settings, OP really listened to their consumers when making their phones and it shows.Battery life - Not having to worry about battery life is such a quality of life improvement, the battery will easily last a day for most heavy users, mine can usually go 2 days or so before needing a top up, which is done extremely quickly.Cons:Charging cables - It's very much a nitpick, but the power cable supplied with this phone is just too short, couple that with the seemingly permanent coiling I have with my wire, it makes it very short indeed and given you don't benefit from the quickcharge with most other cables you may have around, I'd reccomend looking into a longer one, especially hearing poor reliability long term with the standard charging cable, just ensure you buy a quickcharge supported one to avoid disappointments.Fingerprint scanner placement - This one I don't need to spell out too much, but the placement of the scanner and cameras being so close, it's just a fact that the camera is getting smudged now and again by a finger or two, more of an inconvenience than anything but you will get used to this over time.Default Music Player - Upon launching I discovered OnePlus doesn't actually have their own designed music player, instead piggybacking off of Googles Music player, which is no terrible thing for most, but the app lacks in depth and customisation and gets pushy for paid version upgrades (I reccomend switching to either Shuttle or Black Player, I tried both and stuck with Shuttle out of familiarity but both are great players for what they are)Weirdness and other Miscellaneous items:Data transferral -  This model of phone doesn't have an SD card slot as you may or may not know (This nearly caught me when picking out 64 or 128gb of space too) which is no biggie as the space options provided are plentiful, it is an issue when the OP6 didn't actually transfer my data from my original phones SD card too, opting to only move the data from the internal on my old phone, which was only my applications and not the images, music and other such things I planned on, easy enough to transfer manually but an inconvenience I shouldn't have really had.Headphone jack placement - Pause to appreciate the headphone jack still making an appearance, moving on - Located on the bottom of the phone, it can be a little weird picking the phone out, and placing the jack at the top (phone upside down in this case) and then wondering where the buttons are (My old phone had the jack at the top and muscle memory kicks in, such and such)All things considered, truly a great phone option that I'd reccomend to anyone

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_text: I bought this over the 6T as I'd rather have a headphone jack and I also prefer the fingerprint sensor on the rear.I've been using this phone for a few weeks now and my experience has been fantastic.- Great display- Great battery life- Super fast recharge- Great performance- Nice, clean software- Great build quality- Decent cameraMy only issue really is that the camera isn't the best for low light photography. But other than that, there's nothing to complain about. Well worth the money, great value, highly recommended. A true flagship killer.

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_text: Had this handset for almost 3 months now and itâ€™s brilliant in almost every aspect. Battery life is excellent, screen is bright and clear, call quality is excellent, GPS is is fast and accurate and regular updates are reassuring.Camera is excellent but I donâ€™t use it often enough to give a â€˜professionalâ€™ camera review, but itâ€™s good enough for me even in low light shots.Few negatives are:I only use the phone for calls, Sat Nav and very light internet search, so canâ€™t comment on gaming capabilities, the launcher froze on me a few times however, even with light use (Too many times considering the price), I could still see my wallpaper but all icons disappeared, only way to have it responding again was to use gestures for â€˜homeâ€™ button, then clear recent applications. Launcher then starts again. But still, for very light use? Itâ€™s disappointing.Other disappointment is fingerprint scanner, I chose the OP6 over OP6T because of the physical fingerprint scanner, it does fail to recognise my fingerprint too many times. Previous phone was a 3 years old Honor 8, on the course of those 3 years, I probably had to rescan my fingerprint less times than I had to do with the OP6 in 3 months, which is disappointing, regardless of the price of the handset.Overall? Few let downs, but excellent battery life and overall performance make up for it. Hopefully regular future software updates will resolve the few launcher/fingerprint scanner issues and enhance the overall experience.

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_text: Best value for money phone I ever had. My friends and colleagues always asks me what brand of phone am using cause the pictures look the same if not better than their iphone. Battery life could be better but still, from full, gets me through my day without charging, And if a forgot to charge from the night before, no worries, DASH charging is here, tops it up for less than an hour. The best android phone I ever had.

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_text: Was going to go for the 6+ being the latest and being away from oneplus since the 1+3 but opted for the 6 instead. Glad I did, great phone, does it all, fast, great battery, prefer the finger print reader on rear and camera is great. All in all very pleased with the phone

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_text: I was all ready to upgrade my 3 year old Nexus 6P to the new oneplus 6T when the oneplus 6 was discounted by Â£70 for Black Friday. I decided to go with the 6 and what a bargain.OK, I lost a bigger battery, slightly bigger screen and in-display fingerprint reader but gained a headphone jack, a notification light and Â£80 over the 6T.Upgrade to pie and Oxygen 9. Straight away so in essence the same experience.Did quite a bit of research on oneplus and definitely not disappointed.

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_text: This is a great phone. Worth it for the slo-mo camera feature alone, but does everything else you'd expect from an android smartphone. It's fast. Gets my vote!  Video zoom is great - & great for photos too. One point to bear in mind is that with the slo-mo video, zoom cannot be used ..& it doesn't record audio for slo-mo..  However, with the ultra-slow speed at a decent resolution it really is an awesome thing.

title: OnePlus 6 (Dual SIM) 128 GB Android 8.1 Oreo/Oxygen UK Version SIM-Free Smartphone - Midnight Black
review_title: wouldn't buy the same one again not impressed an old Android system compared to my one+6
review_text: Not value for money

title: OnePlus 8T 5G 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with Quad Camera, 65W Warp Charge and Dual SIM - Aquamarine Green - 2 Year Warranty
review_text: After some time away from using OnePlus, I returned to this device after much research. I tend not to follow other reviews, but take on sensible points made. I had an Samsung S10 before and after using for the last 5 weeks, I definitely made the right choice with this. I was amazed at the price to start with, much cheaper than going direct to OnePlus even with their discounts.The phone is slick, I don't mind the jade green, I have a black carbon skin over it. It's very fast, brilliant screen, great camera and generally can't find any fault with it. Yes it has no wireless charging, really, I didn't use it before. Yes it has no 3.5mm Jack, I just use wireless/ Bluetooth; I bought a USB c adapter, job done for a few pounds!!Speakers are great for video playback and streaming my Spotify still sounds great. As for software, I have had no problems, it flies. As for the 5g connectivity, could not get it before, so not going to miss what I can't get; but if I ever need it, then I will just change network if I need it, but really don't care tbh. For me at the price it was a no brainer, the others can keep their Â£1000+ phones, I am very happy with my purchase.UPDATE as of 19/06/22:So after some 8 months of use my positive review still stands; the phone is still just as good as when I first got it. Battery life is still amazing, camera is brilliant so really cannot fault it at all. I recently worked in Cardiff and for the first time I got 5g and it worked great.A few weeks ago I got the Android 12 update, again no issues, all working fine :)

title: OnePlus 8T 5G 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with Quad Camera, 65W Warp Charge and Dual SIM - Aquamarine Green - 2 Year Warranty
review_text: Finally upgraded to the OnePlus 8T from the OnePlus 6 after deciding NOT to go for the OnePlus 9. I initially got the 8gb Ram 128gb storage model for Â£450 (down from Â£550 rrp) as the price difference between that and the 12gb Ram 256gb storage was Â£200! I had the phone for about a week and it was absolutely amazing but something did not sit right. It felt quick but not "fast." A week later I just happened to be browsing Amazon and saw the 12gb 256gb version of the 8T was reduced to Â£550 down from Â£650. So I returned the 8gb model in favour of the 12gb and let me tell you...what an absolute difference. (Hats off to Amazon for their no quibble returns policy).The 12gb ram makes all the difference and it baffles me why this is not a standard amongst all high end smart phones. I use an app called Simple System Monitor which shows me my CPU and Ram usage. The phone without any apps running was using 5.5gb of ram so when I was using ram intensive apps on the 8gb model...the android OS was closing apps that were opened the earliest to make way for the newly opened apps as the ram usage was maxing out. Using the 12gb model makes this a non-issue because the extra 4gb of ram means that more apps can be open without the need to close others and results in the phone operating a lightning quick speeds.Along with bigger ram, the 8T boasts an Octo-Core Snapdragon 865 processor which makes light work of everything I use my phone for including the 120hz display which just makes everything so fluid and lush. YouTube videos look absolutely amazing and realistic as if you are actually filming it yourself and games look incredibly detailed. Throw in 256gb storage and a 48 Megapixel camera capable of recording 4K videos and you have yourself a serious phone. If you are a gamer then the Adreno 650 graphics chip will more than suit your needs as it works amazingly with the processor and ram. It also has all the other features that youâ€™d expect from a smartphone these days such as Blueooth 5.1, NFC etcThe phone itself is quite heavy weighing in at 188g but then again so was my OnePlus 6 so that is not an issue. It feels well built and premium compared to other phones as it has an Aluminium frame with a gorilla glass front and back. It has a 4500mah battery which can be fully charged in 30 minutes via 65W Warp Charge. This will last up to 2 days of normal use however, if you use the phone constantly then you can probably get about 5-6 hours out if it. The 12gb model comes in an Aqua Marine Green colour which I have to admit doesnâ€™t look as good as the Lunar Silver the 8gb comes in however, my phone is permanently in an official OnePlus 8T protective case so this isnâ€™t an issue for me.Downsides: -- No headphone jack rendering my wired Sennheiser Headphones obsolete.- On screen finger-print scanner can be temperamental.- Doesnâ€™t work well with 3rd party tempered glass screens, 1st party expensive.I fully recommend this phone to anyone looking to upgrade to a high end flagship killer smartphone. It is barely 6 months old and yet still thrashes a lot of other smartphone brands including Samsung. Yes, the OnePlus 9 is available and it is â€œnewerâ€ but unless you are an absolute tech geek or just have too much money to burn then I recommend the OnePlus 8T 12gb Ram model.

title: OnePlus 8T 5G 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with Quad Camera, 65W Warp Charge and Dual SIM - Aquamarine Green - 2 Year Warranty
review_text: Oneplus make amazing phones - This is my 4th onplus and I've never been disappointed.The phone is is clean, and super quick and responsive with the 8/12gb ram the put in their phone. Never any slowdown, like ever. Screen is bright, clean and crisp, Storage is huge, so never a problem there too. Camera really good tooPhone is perfect size & weight, and looks great. Sliiiiiiightly on the thick side though? But that just enables a larger battery. Lasts more than a day and charges in about 10 minutes. No exaggeration.One of the things I love most about oneplus phones is that the never seem to get any worse as they get older. They last  years each, and even then they are still great phones and are just as quick as the day I bought them - I generally only replace them for cosmetic damage that's my fault. My family still use my old oneplus5 as our backup phone and it's still just grand!

title: OnePlus 8T 5G 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with Quad Camera, 65W Warp Charge and Dual SIM - Aquamarine Green - 2 Year Warranty
review_text: Had this phone for a couple of weeks now and quite impressed with the speed and quality. Battery has been much better than my previous iPhone and I particularly love the fast charging - amazingly quick. Would recommend anyone trying a One+ phone, excellent value for money.Only gripe is the omission of wireless charging but with how quickly it charges and the decent battery life ...... who cares.

title: OnePlus 8T 5G 12GB RAM 256GB Storage SIM-Free Smartphone with Quad Camera, 65W Warp Charge and Dual SIM - Aquamarine Green - 2 Year Warranty
review_text: The trick with OnePlus is to buy the SECOND most recent model. It's usually near half the price of the latest, but with almost the same features. This is a classic example.12 GB RAM. 256 GB storage. 5G compatibility. A sumptuous AMOLED screen. Astonishingly good cameras. Screaming-fast processors. Shockingly swift charge using the included charger. It even comes with a clear bumper case!There is literally nothing not to like about this phone. At the price, it's an absolute steal, blowing Apple and Samsung (to name two of similar quality) out of the water.There's a single gotcha. As with a lot of other modern phones, OnePlus has eliminated the headphone socket. You'll need to buy either a USB-C headset or a Bluetooth one. Fortunately, you can now get a decent USB-C headset for under a tenner, so I'm not going to deduct a star for that.My last OnePlus (5) has lasted four years, and is still going. I've only replaced it because OnePlus has stopped providing software updates. I expect this 8T to last as long.

title: OnePlus Nord 2T 5G (UK) - 8GB RAM 128GB SIM Free Smartphone with 50MP AI Triple Camera and 80W SUPERVOOC Fast Charging - Grey Shadow [UK version]
review_title: When on sale, Was prime money for a mid range phone
review_text: Acquired this item just after new years during a sale and when the product was much lower in value. The base model was Â£298 to Â£320, with the option of the ear buds bundle i acquired it for Â£347. Which for a mid range phone is absolute bang for value. But the phone is currently at Â£400+ which seems to be stretching it. at that point you may as well opt for a "Google Pixel 6A" which is ranked as the best value for a mid range phone.But Enough of the value for quality and performance. Does it preform well.... Yes!Bellow i will list everything great about the phone.- The  Nord 2T sports a hefty quad core mediatek dimensity 1300 CPU, With an ARM Mali-G77 MC9 GPU. You will always find the phone responsive in every circumstances, Offers above average performance when gaming however might have issues on certain open world games.- The Nord 2T Sports a brilliant 8GB of ram for a mid range phone with an option to expand memory capacity by an additional 2-3-5GB within the operation system itself. This converts 2-3-5GB from your internal storage capacity to be used as RAM for the phone to take advantage of. For those of you that are a serious hoarder of apps being on in the background. this is a dream feature for a mid range phone!- Fingerprint scanner allows you to save multiple fingerprints if you like unlocking your phone with different fingers.- SUPERCHARGING.... im not joking here when i say that this phone can charge dam quick which is great and concerning at the same time. For a battery perspective charging this quick is concerning as it will degrade the battery incredibly quickly. But on the other hand it means if you need the phone charged in a flash it will fully charge a dead phone from 0 to 100% in under 30mins. in order to preserve battery life if you do decide to acquire this phone i would recommend at every step to enable all charging features so as it does not degrade the battery as quickly.- Camera quality is top note. offers ultra wide photography as well as probably one of the best low light/night time video recording and photo taking processing. Doesn't oversaturate it as much as you would think but proves that in low light conditions its brilliant.My overall recommendation is if you can grab this bellow Â£360. its 100% one the money, anything more youre looking at compromising value for money which there is far greater options available bellow the current price point of the phone which is at Â£403, But this is just my advise. But at current value i dont see why it would be worth it considering the One Plus Nord 10t just launched and is sitting at Â£463, which provides far superior processing, and GPU capabilities ontop of a better battery and the same expandability with your RAM, Youre looking at an average 34% increase in performance for an additional Â£60

title: OnePlus Nord 2T 5G (UK) - 8GB RAM 128GB SIM Free Smartphone with 50MP AI Triple Camera and 80W SUPERVOOC Fast Charging - Grey Shadow [UK version]
review_title: Initial impressions are good. Camera and phone review.
review_text: I've had the phone a few days now and here are my first impressions.As a videographer and occasional photographer I value certain things in my phone and whilst this handset is by no means the creme de la creme of smartphones but I think it deserves a lot of praise for what it does well.These days I'm not able to afford the flagships with their top end camera systems, but this is one of those handsets that makes you ask if you really need to anymore.The last "flagship I used  was the Huawei P20 Pro. In fact I'm going to be mentally comparing quality of that handset to the main camera here in the Nord 2T. The other 2 lenses are poor and there to make up numbers, but a few years ago even our flagships packed one good camera and we were mostly happy.Today it's surprising how good phones are at capturing sharp video and images. The lightness of this handset is appreciated and there are times when it's simply not convenient to use a dedicated camcorder or my old DSLR (I'm yet to justify the jump to a superior mirrorless system).Comparing my old P20 Pro, a phone lauded for it's cameras in 2018, I have to say I'm really impressed. Autofocus on the Nord 2T is sharp, fast and accurate, the p20 would seratch for focus as soon as there was lots of movement in the frame when videoing, resulting in lots of out of focus, unuseable footage. Details are good and low light performance seems bettrr in my limited testing. Yes, there are better cameras, but for the price, this is a great little handset.I'd personally like more controls, the ability to disable OIS when my phone is mounted on my gimbal, but this phone shoots way better video than my older P20 Pro, a weakness of that handset.Still Images seem sharp, maybe overshsrpened, detailed but over processed as is the norm for Chinese phones who seem to prefer images that pop over those more natural. I quite like the look though. Low light performance of the main 50MP camera is strong for the price and better than my older handset. At 50MP, a 2x digital zoom (crop) is still a decent image and surprisingly usable . I don't zoom my images normally, preferring to crop in post, but I'd have no qualms here shooting at 2x for online use as images are detailed and sharp.The pnone itself is really nice to use. Yes, I'd prefer a more stock android as certain changes the OxygenOS 12 has made are not as good as the original Google implementation. Settings menus especially are overcomplicated and certain elements of the Material You design language does appear lost in this and every other Chinese translation I've seen.That said, I'm used to Chinese UIs by now and they tend to add lots, even if the first thing I do is put either Nova or Lawnchair launcher on them for a more stock skin. What I don't like is the default to the iPhone style home screens. We Android users like our app drawer, we don't want the chaos of multiple homescreens of randomly placed icons greeting us after a backup from our accounts onto our new handset. It takes time to clean up this mess but once done, this, is as simple to use as any other in day to day usage.The interface is snappy, the battery simply good, not amazing. It'll easily last most users a full 24 hours and when it doesn't, charging on the boxed 80w charger is simply lightning. 0% to full in about 30 mins. It doesn't get too hot, I've had no real hiccups in my first few days with it. The odd stutter but generally, apps load quicklyand everything seems as fast as any top end phone I remember using.The handset design is a mixed bagThere is something a little disconcerting about the cross eyed, off centre camera alignment, the design itself possible works, though the camera bump is pretty massive and you certainly can't lay this thing at all flat until you put it in the supplied case and even then it isn't flat, but I like aspects of the design. The shadow grey frosted glass back may not pick up fingerprints, but it's a slippery and whilst feeling quality I don't think I'll be pulling this out to look at it as I did with the P20 Pro or even my old Oppo Find x2 Neo I used as my daily handset until recently. It's not the most attractive handset I've owned in all honesty but I bought this for function over form and it feels sturdy and premium, works well and was a great price.The biggest area where I am not impressed is the quality of the built in stereo speakers. With bluetooth 5.2 and aptX I'm unlikely to have to worry too much but I was disappointed in all honesty as these were a step back not only on the previous Huawei Handsets I'd owned (Mate 9 was brilliant), but worse than the Find X2 Neo which I loved (except for it's mediocre camera performance).. If you need to use them they are there, but they're pretty terrible, bassless and prone to distort at high volumes when playing music. Watching streaming services they sounded better, but they're lacklustre at best and when pushed sound exactly like the cost cutting, cheaply made speakers they are.Brightness of the screen is the only other criticism. I'm yet to use it on a bright sunny day, but outdoors it's not the brightest. I do hope I don't regret this when filming my partners American football practices on sunny days but it's just not very bright. Everything else, indoors I'm happy with the HDR 10+ screen. It's everything you expect from an AMOLED screen and the 90Hz makes the android experience smoother, I just wish it got brighter outdoors.To conclude, the Oneplus Nord 2T is a good handset for the money. Its not going to win prizes in a beauty contest and isn't flawless but you can't expect flawless in the midrange. It's got a good main camera (I didn't review the other 2 lenses as they are pretty pointless) and everything else is as good as it should be with the odd niggle, but overall this handset is a rapid little performer than makes using it a breeze and a pleasure.

title: OnePlus Nord 2T 5G (UK) - 8GB RAM 128GB SIM Free Smartphone with 50MP AI Triple Camera and 80W SUPERVOOC Fast Charging - Grey Shadow [UK version]

title: OnePlus Nord 2T 5G (UK) - 8GB RAM 128GB SIM Free Smartphone with 50MP AI Triple Camera and 80W SUPERVOOC Fast Charging - Grey Shadow [UK version]
review_title: No mem card slot or macro lense. Nice phone though
review_text: Nice little phone for the black Friday price. Wouldn't pay full price for it. No mem card slot but can upload using usb storage. No macra camera which ud expect. Over all quite impressed. Compared to my p30 pro that I've had 3 yrs, I'm happy with it as a 2nd phone. What I've used of the camera I'm really impressed with the quality of the 10x zoom. Nice and crisp image. Yet to use it outside but all looks good using it at home. Finger print reader seems OK even with my dry cracked hands, face regognition is OK, bit annoying that u have to scroll screen up to unlock. Doesn't just open when I look at it like my Huawei. But does prevent it unlocking every time a car comes towards me at night when my phones in its holder. If ur looking for a nice phone that does pretty much anything I'd deffo buy it at the reduced price

title: HONOR X6a Mobile Phone Unlocked, 6.5-Inch 90Hz Fullview Display, 4GB+128GB, 5200 mAh Long-lasting Battery, 50MP Triple Camera, Android 13(2 Year Warranty), Midnight Black
review_text: I recently purchased the HONOR X6a Mobile Phone and I am extremely impressed with its performance. The 6.5-inch 90Hz Fullview Display is stunning, providing crisp and clear visuals for all my activities. The 4GB+128GB storage capacity is more than enough for all my apps, photos, and videos.The 5200 mAh long-lasting battery is a game-changer for me. I no longer have to worry about constantly charging my phone throughout the day. The battery life is exceptional and lasts me through heavy usage without any issues.The 50MP triple camera is another standout feature of this phone. The picture quality is top-notch, capturing every detail with clarity and precision. I have been able to take some amazing photos with this camera and I am thoroughly impressed with the results.The Android 13 operating system is smooth and responsive, making navigation a breeze. The phone is fast and efficient, handling multiple tasks with ease. Additionally, the 2-year warranty provides peace of mind knowing that my phone is protected.Overall, I highly recommend the HONOR X6a Mobile Phone to anyone in the market for a new device. It offers a fantastic display, impressive battery life, excellent camera quality, and reliable performance. The Cyan Lake Blue color is also a nice touch, adding a pop of color to the sleek design. This phone is definitely worth the investment. All my family use this brand!

title: HONOR X6a Mobile Phone Unlocked, 6.5-Inch 90Hz Fullview Display, 4GB+128GB, 5200 mAh Long-lasting Battery, 50MP Triple Camera, Android 13(2 Year Warranty), Midnight Black
review_title: Good price, good features, good cameras, looks nice
review_text: Makes more sense to get one these rather than spend hundreds or thousands of pounds on a smartphone. Has good capacity, good features, good cameras, works well, good price, some people (influenced by marketing propaganda) call this sort of phone an 'entry level' smartphone, but I don't see what is 'entry level' about it, it does everything you need in most cases, loads of features and possibilities.

title: HONOR X6a Mobile Phone Unlocked, 6.5-Inch 90Hz Fullview Display, 4GB+128GB, 5200 mAh Long-lasting Battery, 50MP Triple Camera, Android 13(2 Year Warranty), Midnight Black
review_text: This is my 3rd honor phone, I had an honor 6,an honor 7s and now this one, this is bigger than the previous 2 phones which is a bonus for me due to mobility issues which includes issues with my hands, so this phone can rest in my hand instead of me having to hold it, however with it being larger it also weighs quite a bit more than the 7s.As with most of the other reviews, the camera on this phone is a lot better than the 6 and 7s which is a nice feature to have.One major problem with my phone is the speaker, during a call the speaker stops working properly and you can barely hear the person you are talking to, however this does not happen during a phone call on loud speaker but does happen when on facetime, being quite deaf this does cause me a few problems. This problem could just be an issue with my phone though.For the price I am happy with the phone, I have purposely not downloaded many apps so the processing speed does not reduce, as my 7s was not broken, it was just really slow, I am able to use the 7s for the 3 games I play occasionally and the shopping apps I need, so allowed me not to have to download apps that could slow my phone down.I cannot go into technical details because I do not understand the technical side, what is important to me is that the phone works as I am severely disabled and housebound so having a reliable phone is not only important for me but also for my family to be able to contact me, the processing speed is good and I can take nice photos of my family. The apps that were already installed do not seem to slow the phone down and apps I would never use have been uninstalled which is an added bonus because I have had phones in the past where you have to have pre installed apps and could not remove them. I use my home Internet on the phone but living in the middle of the country the Internet can go down sometimes, so I will need to use my data that I can watch Netflix, prime and you tube, with the phone being bigger it makes watching the above really easy.If like me you want a no nonsense phone that is easy to use this is an ideal choice. I am sure there are many other things you can do with the phone as both my sons have said they could use the phone and still able to everything they do on there way more expensive phones, so to me this is a very good phone and not too expensive.

title: HONOR X6a Mobile Phone Unlocked, 6.5-Inch 90Hz Fullview Display, 4GB+128GB, 5200 mAh Long-lasting Battery, 50MP Triple Camera, Android 13(2 Year Warranty), Midnight Black
review_text: I bought this phone as a backup phone while my expensive Samsung phone was off for repair. I've been using it now for a couple of weeks and can honestly say I can't fault it. It has to be the most amazing value for money smartphone on the market right now.It has a fantastic battery life better than my Â£1000 + Samsung. The camera is about as good as my Samsung. It has latest Android with all the apps you want. It has a nice big screen and messaging was better than my Samsung the text predict seemed better and I can read it better without the use of reading glasses all the time.The storage space and device speed is also impressive.If I wasn't bothered about having a foldable big main screen for my trading charts and wanted a great value smartphone that does everything you need and well then I would happily have this as my main phone.

title: HONOR 90 Lite Smartphone 5G with 100MP Triple Camera, 8+256GB, 6,7â€šÃ„Ã¹ 90Hz Display, 4500mAh, Dual SIM, Android 13, Cyan lake
review_title: Fit for purpose, fantastic value for money.  Highly recommended.
review_text: I bought the HONOR 90 Lite to replace my 5.5 year old Honor 9 Lite which was starting to show signs of age. Previous to this, I was stuck in the extortion Apple bubble.  Thanks to the availability of so many affordable, reliable, and high quality android brands, I decided to make the brave transition and have never looked back with any regret.Having used this Honor 90 Lite for a month,  I am very pleased with the upgrade and hugely impressed by the quality / features / price ratio. The vastly improved specifications is a huge leap forward compare to the 9  Lite with only 3gb RAM, 32gb Storage, a 3000mah battery, and a 13 MP main camera.  Thanks to the the main stars which are the generous 8gb RAM and the whopping 256gb storage, this phone is extremely snappy and a pleasure to operate.  The 100MP main camera takes brilliant photos, while the larger screen and the ultra thin bezel deliver a much improved visual experience.With the unique Honor app DEVICE CLONE, I was able to transfer all datas ( including all my downloaded APPS) from the old HONOR to the new HONOR effortlessly using a C to C cable ( an adaptor is needed on the old phone as it is a micro USB).  The only APP that I had to apply more work is WHATSAPP, as I wanted all my contacts and chat history to be transferred as well.There are some drawbacks including lack of 3.5 jack, no internal memory card slot, lower screen brightness, and the screen is LCD and not AMOLED.  However, I can accept the minor compromise as I donâ€™t feel like paying Â£100 more for these features found in the Redmi Note 13 5G with similar camera size, memory and storage capacity.As technology changes so rapidly theses days, the relatively affordable price of this reliable Chinese phone means that I can upgrade to newer technology more often without feeling guilty.

title: HONOR 90 Lite Smartphone 5G with 100MP Triple Camera, 8+256GB, 6,7â€šÃ„Ã¹ 90Hz Display, 4500mAh, Dual SIM, Android 13, Cyan lake
review_title: The glassy finish is very slippery
review_text: Excellent little phone! If you have had an iPhone and are transitioning to an android this phone is right up your street! The layout, icon placement and gestures all mimic an iPhone. (Can be changed in the settings for the original android 13 if wanted too, with normal buttons and layout).It's pretty quick, very responsive and the camera on this phone is fantastic. Anyone that does a spot of photography or vlogging this phone will do just that! (Obviously bear in mind the camera is no SLR).I used the clone phone feature and put everything from my old phone across onto this one effortlessly.You get a charge lead in the box but no charging plug/brick. Not really a worry considering it's applicable with other chargers around the house.Other than that be prepared for this phone's finish. It's very premium and looks and feels great. Very smooth glass.However the one downside I found! 100% buy yourself a case and screen protector alongside your purchase. The oils in your fingers and hand make the phone just slip right out of your grip and would be very easy to drop. I got a screen protector and a wallet style case which worked fine.Other than that, if this phone broke or I lost it, I'd straight away buy the same phone as a replacement. It's features and specs are top notch for the price.No need to sign up for a two year contract to buy into a "brand" name with half the features and specs.The HONOR brand nailed it out the box with this one.Deffinately consider this for a next phone!

title: HONOR Magic6 Lite, Sim-Free Mobile Phones, 5G Smartphone, 8GB+256GB, 6,78â€šÃ„Ã¹ Anti-Drop 120Hz Display, 108MP Triple Rear Camera, 5300mAh Battery, Dual SIM, Android 13, Emerald Green
review_text: I was faced with having to pay Â£120 to replace my 3 year old Samsung S20 FE battery or change phone for a new one. Decided after looking at lots of different models to choose the Honor Magic 5 lite especially as it was on a prime deal.Loved the lightweight feel, the great colour, the fact its almost as good at everything than my Samsung was, apart from I would say a slightly less good camera system, it's such good value.Don't be put off by stories about Chinese government links, its got Google inbuilt as they have decided its now a safe phone, not like Huawei phones.The day after installing everything the android OS m updated to latest Honor skin version magic 7 which is android 13 effectively not 12.I sold my old Samsung for Â£50 as battery needed replacing which as I said would cost a buyer but everything worked. That meant I only paid Â£175 for my new Honor magic 5 lite. At that price it is excellent value, and performs as good as phones 3 times that price eg my old Samsung is still around Â£500.Dont hesitate, a great buy.

title: HONOR Magic6 Lite, Sim-Free Mobile Phones, 5G Smartphone, 8GB+256GB, 6,78â€šÃ„Ã¹ Anti-Drop 120Hz Display, 108MP Triple Rear Camera, 5300mAh Battery, Dual SIM, Android 13, Emerald Green
review_text: Superficially, an attractive slim phone, in enticing colour. The "smart" bit works well. The camera functions as it should, good internet connections, sound colours. Visually a smart phone.However, the "phone" aspect was a disaster. I could phone out, but incoming calls were irregular. Sometimes you could receive them, other times no. Plus, you didn't get a warning that you had missed a call. Not acceptable when the phone only has 2 functions, phoning out and phoning in. Incoming calls were consistently inconsistent.We tried everything, changing SIMs, spent ages with BT tecchies.Honor customer services were anything but. No service.They said I could have it repaired. I replied a new phone shouldn't need repairing.I had lost confidence in the brand and I wanted my money back - not a replacement or a repair.Amazon Customer Services were brilliant and I received the refund via their good offices.

title: HONOR Magic6 Lite, Sim-Free Mobile Phones, 5G Smartphone, 8GB+256GB, 6,78â€šÃ„Ã¹ Anti-Drop 120Hz Display, 108MP Triple Rear Camera, 5300mAh Battery, Dual SIM, Android 13, Emerald Green
review_text: So many phones to choose from in this.price range but I feel like I choose wisely with this. Battery is so much better than any other phone. Can lasts 2 days without charge.Camera is good. Specs are good. Can't complain.

title: HONOR X7b Mobile Phone Unlocked, 108MP Triple Camera, 6.8" 90Hz Fullview Display, 6 GB+128 GB, Android 13, Dual SIM, Emerald Green
review_title: So far the best phone I've owned
review_text: I'm not a fan of big-name brand phones that cost as much as a car, so I try to look for lesser-known brands or cheaper brands. I had never heard of HONOR prior to finding this model on Amazon when searching for a new phone. I've got to say, it's an enormous upgrade from my old Huawei phone which, by comparison, seems like a tiny and sluggish piece of ancient technology. The HONOR's thumbprint reader is such a great way to lock/unlock the phone and I've got to say the camera for a phone of this price is also surprisingly impressive. The only thing I'm disappointed about is the lack of a 3.5mm headphone jack, but that's probably more a sign of me being old fashioned and stuck in my ways since those ports are being phased out on newer tech as far as I can tell.Would recommend this phone to anyone looking for something modestly priced but fiercely competitive in terms of specs and speed. Oh... and the battery life is blowing my mind. Not having to charge it every day is going to take some getting used to and I'm loving it.

title: HONOR X7b Mobile Phone Unlocked, 108MP Triple Camera, 6.8" 90Hz Fullview Display, 6 GB+128 GB, Android 13, Dual SIM, Emerald Green
review_text: I've had this phone for a few weeks and have only used it on WiFi. I was getting ready to load up all my music when found there was no micro sd card slot. Unfortunately I missed this in the specs, as the x6 and x7 have memory expansion.To people who who use the cloud and streaming services and don't have masses of files to store, they may be happy with this phone. To me it's a massive downgrade, I'd rather have a slower processor and fewer megapixels. Another thing I noticed, can't really blame it on this particular phone but a 6.7 inch screen makes the phone too big to practically carry around it, doesn't fit in all pockets. Quite a disappointment I'm left wishing I bought the lower specified x7a or even x6.After using this phone on WiFi for a couple of months I have noticed that it is quicker, better photos, and Bluetooth than my old phone. The fast charger works brilliantly and I definitely prefer this screen for Internet and also WhatsApp calls.I still think it's a shame they left out the expansion slot but have raised my review from 2 stars to 4 because the phone works so well.

Depending on the music app you don't have to play around with the volume settings to much and it produces decent play back levels (Even better with a good set of headphones). Overall, I would recommend it, just bear in mind that you are buying a supposed budget device and it does have its limitations.

review_text: I was impressed with the battery life going all day and some,  Everything you need on a phone and large clear display. review_text: Actually there is nothing to dislike. They are all positive things I can write, but this phone Honor 70 Lite, speaks for itself! In my time I've used and tried many mobile phones but this Honor is so stable, you can boost the refresh time, there isn't any bloat apps installed, the camera is so good you think you were using a really expensive phone. I've been using it now for 10 months and can say that the battery hasn't let me down, I'm running approx 100 apps and for most of them I don't set the battery optimiser and the battery lasts and lasts!Best thing is when I turn it on in the morning (cos I like a bit of quiet when asleep) well worth it and for myself I hope they upgrade the system from 12 to 13 then my day would be complete. Once again a good reliable mobile phone! Ps. Almost forgot it's a 5g system as well as 4g, 2g. I'm using 5g but for this check the coverage in your area!

However it does state in the Amazon description that it does.While this is not a deal breaker, you should expect a phone of this price to come with everything in the description.Also the Amazon deal at the time of my purchase promised free headphones (worth Â£400) they didn't come and on contacting Amazon, they didn't have any idea of this promo, so another star off. they have since taken this deal down.The phone itself is snappy and great really premium feel, though many apps wont go into split screen though, so you will have to put up with floating windows side by side a lot. your paying for the novelty of having a thin fold phone more than anything

title: HONOR Magic4 Pro - 5G Smartphone 8+256GB, 6.81" 120Hz Curved Screen, Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 Processor, 50MP Triple Camera, 100W SuperCharge, 4600mAh Battery, NFC, IP68, Dual SIM, Android 12, Black
review_text: Firstly if you've ever owned a Huawei phone, you'll feel like you've been introduced to an old friend.I currently have a galaxy s22 ultra and I wanted to try this phone out because it seems great....on paper.I've only had it a day and some things have infuriated me. I have an Honor watch and I couldn't connect the thing! The play store app wouldn't work, so I had to use an apk site, that didn't work either. I read and watched all the YouTube videos on how to do it, and still no luck. I'm tech savvy, so I think I know my stuff. But this has frustrated me for six hours! I've found a work around and thankfully it works. You have to download the petal health app from the play store btw. ðŸ‘Also another big concern, you can't use split screen mode! So if you're used to using two apps simultaneously, you can't! There's a work around for this too, download an app in the play store called split screen and that has worked for my main two apps I use for split screen.I haven't had much chance to test the rest, but I'll give it a go and update this review. Hopefully I don't find anything else wrong and have to send it back.**upadated ** 11/11/22Ive had the phone a month now, it's great. Pros :Face unlock is incredible, even in the dark.The fingerprint scanner is fantastic too.The camera is great as point and shoot.Charging speeds! Unbelievable.Cons :Battery doesn't last me as long, I have to typically put it on charge at 19:00-20:00. By this stage I'm down to 20%, but the 100w charger takes care of this.You can't find a decent case for it.That's it. Great phone, with a few quirks.Updated - 7/12/22I tried the Oppo find x5 pro for a day and I quickly went back to this phone. The ultrasonic fingerprint sensor and the 3d face unlock is far superior. Honestly this phone is so underrated.

title: Honor 10 Lite 3GB/64GB Sky Blue Dual SIM HRY-LX1
review_title: Shutting down in Whatsapp, YouTube, playing any video, etc
review_text: This phone has worked well for 11 months until a few days ago.It now shuts down using several apps.It does this even in Safe mode.A mobile phone has to work longer than a year to be of any value.The Amazon returns window lasted only 1 month.I have returned the phone to factory settings and have the same problem.Before reset, I cloned it to my old Honor Lite 10. Everything works fine.I have spent hours setting passwords, accounts, security etc.UPDATE: I requested a refund/repair from Technolec and was told the returns window had expired.I requested a refund through my VISA card but was told that, since Amazon made the payment, they were not liable.So the 1 month returns window is a great scam. Unless you are prepared to take the seller to court, you have no redress.I shall be reconsidering my purchases through Amazon.In the meantime, I will send a weekly email to Technolec, reminding them of there legal oblications under UK consumer law.Buyer beware.UPDATEI have sent them another email but nor reply.I rang them but no reply.UPDATEI have contacted my VISA card provider again, as a barrister friend has challenged the bank's view that they are not liable. Amazon UK are clearly the seller.UPDATEIn the interim, I have tried to get a postal repair but found that the warranty expired 6 months before I bought it. So Amazon are selling phones that are out of warranty.

title: OPPO Find X3 Lite 5G - 8GB RAM and 128GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.4 inch, 64MP Quad Camera, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: Really needed to upgrade my phone and landed on this one as a replacement.I didn't need something too techy for what I regularly use but this is packed full of features my previous phone lacked.Pros:â€¢ Very nice camera and video qualityâ€¢ Great storageâ€¢ Fast chargingâ€¢ Long lasting battery (one charge lasts me the entire day even with a lot of usage)â€¢  Very nice biometricâ€¢ Vibrant screen with opinions to change it for eye comfortâ€¢ Loads fastâ€¢ Displays charge of Bluetooth itemsâ€¢ Easy to set up and navigateCons:â€¢ Can't increase storage which some who use phones for games would probably be looking forâ€¢ Doesn't have the option for mini screening separate apps to overlayâ€¢ Some reason the battery icon is always redIt's definitely a great phone for the price!

title: OPPO Find X3 Lite 5G - 8GB RAM and 128GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.4 inch, 64MP Quad Camera, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: Over the past five years (probably longer) I've switched between iPhones, Samsung and Google pixel devices, mostly because they're what I know and they're supposed to be the best of the best. But I've just got bored.Ive been looking for along time at what I could find that's new and decided it would be the find x3 neo or the OnePlus 9. (OnePlus is basically oppo anyway) I'm so glad I went with this one and I'll explain why.Build Quality:build quality it great, I love the colour, I went with galactic silver and it's beautiful, I love how it changes colour depending on how the light reflects off it. It has a nice matted glass back that doesnt show fingerprints (none at all) although this does make it feel a little bit like plastic but it's better than being smudgy and ugly all the time! The phone does have a bit of weight to it but also surprisingly light for the size, but it's enough to feel premium, the craftsmenship being up there with Samsung!Display:The screen is one of the best, covered with gorilla glass 5 and a nice screen protector out the box, it has a slight curve on the edges but doesn't seem to cause any issues with accidental touches, the 90hz refresh rate is nice, obviously not up there with the 120hz powerhouses but it's definitely a win over iPhones 60hz... The colours are amazing and is a truly great panel! HDR10+  also supported.Camera:Exceptional actually, it really is a great camera, there's 4 built in but I'm not really sure what part they all play as I focus more on the standard modes, with portrait mode also being a great go to that works probably just as well as Samsung and apples offering.. not up there with pixel but it's not far off, good dynamic range, white balance and focus, everything's good and I'm really surprised by how much it impressed me!Software:This is what sold it for me, I mean it's android so.. well... It's android! and I know what to expect, but it's the other bits, the color os and oppo bits that made it for me, it's fun and different ( a good change) how long it'll last on me I don't know, but I am loving the experience! It's clean and modern, little animations here and there and features everywhere! You can also personalise it as much as you like.. now when you first set it up the standard home screen mode is a little annoying and doesn't have the app draw but after navigating round the settings I was able to change it! Talking of the settings app, this is probably my only complaint, things are difficult to find in here and navigating is a pain to say the least, nothing is where you expect it to be and it's all a bit confusing, I just stick to typing what I want into the search and let it present itself to me! It's annoying but not a turn off.So to summerise a few pros and consPros-- build quality- camera- screen- software-its differentCons-- No wireless charging- the odd stutter when doing some tasks- last year's processor- no waterproofing or dust resistance ratingOverall I'm really happy with this phone, and just thought I'd share these points with anyone thats maybe not sure on their next phone, it shouldn't disappoint!I think I might be a new oppo fan

title: OPPO Find X3 Lite 5G - 8GB RAM and 128GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.4 inch, 64MP Quad Camera, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: Moving from a Xiaomi Mi 10 5G Lite, this "Find X3 Neo" mobile is certainly a step up! It seems very quick and without hesitation in everything it does.With 256GB of memory, there's plenty to spare even when I load up with a lot of music to play in the car.I have the silver version - which is stylish and IMHO, looks good! Overall, everything seems to be well made and sturdy. The mobile has a reasonable weight and feels good in the hand.The display and the cameras are brilliant.  Charging is amazingly rapid and the device comes with a silicon case and a ready fitted film type screen protector.The Android 11 implementation is reasonably "vanilla" without an overload of bloatware. What there is, can mostly be easily disabled if necessary.I used the OPPO cloning app on my old Xiaomi and remarkably all my settings, data, media files and apps transferred over rather painlessly. I've not had that before! I presume life was made easier by both mobiles being on Android 11.Just one app failed to transfer - and I simply reloaded it from Google Play. I then deleted some of the Xiaomi bloatware that managed to make it across.I did have to manually set up the Home Screen in my preferred "drawer" mode. I also added "File Manager +" as it also provides seamless local network access to our home NAS/Media Server. So, I can download music and films, and upload photos etc.I have had no issues with WiFi, NFC and Bluetooth. 5G gives some amazing data transfer rates. Battery life is usually more than sufficient for me for a day.So, overall I am most chuffed! The mobile is a joy to use with performance at a par with many flagship devices. The Amazon option of 12 monthly payments make it a viable alternative to a long term agreement - with the flexibility and savings of a "SIM Only" contract.However, this is not a cheap device and there are a couple of small gripes:- No glass screen protectors work on this device as keyboard and fingerprint sensor sensitivity are lost rendering the mobile unusable. So, unlike me, don't remove the factory fitted film screen protector! I have had to replace it with a soft 'hydrogel' one...- It appears to be impossible to lose the Google app from the home screen tabs (RH swipe). I managed to get rid of it on my Xiaomi but OPPO seem to have blocked that option. You can disable "Discovery" (that chews data in the background) but Google Search annoyingly remains.....- The mobile is dust rather than water-proof.- There is only a small choice of cases available - particularly wallet/flip types.Wireless charging would have been great but the rapid charge capability does compensate.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: Typically, I've used flagship samsungs (S22 Ultra), Sonys (Xperia 5 IV) or pixels.My most recent pixel was giving me issues with the charging port and I wanted a change.  I decided to opt for something more 'modest' in price, but hopefully still achieving a high spec for my money.Summary - This fulfilled my needs perfectly. Punches much higher for its price point, and although it has last years processor (albeit, high-end - worth remembering) you really would never know - and why should you?! Feels great, looks great, screen is superb - and the unboxing experience has nice touches (see below).PROs- Superb premium aesthetics (inc. the camera bump), and it feels great in the hand- Bundled cover is good quality, a great compliment to it, and has a grippy feel (silicone)- Fast and snappy UI- Nice software touches/options (e.g. always on display options, and fingerprint animation options etc)- Great camera quality- Face recognition is excellent, even in low light / accurate & quick fingerprint reader- Bundled 80W charger is wonderful (25%-100% took 25 mins on initial charge!)- Battery could easily last 2 daysCONs- Not having google photos as my default gallery app is a nuisance(...and that's it - genuinely)

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: I've been using this one for a while now and I still enjoy it a lot.I was pleasantly surprised to see it arrive with a rubber case (not transparant!), and a screen protector already on it. Both surprisingly good quality, as they both still look great after a good while of using them.I love the photos and videos as I can shoot raw and edit my heart out.The phone feels snappy and I have had only one issue so far (which is now resolved):I was unable to get Google Assistant voice to work. The setup would get interrupted each time I tried. A software update (much) later fixed this and now everything works like a charm.I would buy an Oppo again in the future.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: Replaced anold Sony Xperia The new phone is easy to use Also the Oppo is much cheaper and in my opinion so far competes favourably with the Sony

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: I was very sceptical when I bought the oppo find x5 on pre-order because I had no prior experience with the brand, but after almost 6 months of use I can say I really like the phone. I tend to buy flagship models of phones because I love taking photographs and like a good quality camera for when I do not have my DSLR with me. This phone take amazing quality pictures and I cannot fault Oppo on that front. The phone's interface is great and somewhere between Huawei and Samsung I would say but a really great interface. On the downside, the screen picks up fingerprints easily so I find I am contantly cleaning it. In addition, there are a few small features that I am missing from ther phones I had before such as that I can only access my camera from the lock screen, but not my flashlight or calculator. When in my picture gallary, I cannot select to edit a picture through other editing software on my phone directly, I need to open the reloevant software and find the relevant picture again. As I said, very small things that would make a big difference to my use of the phone but I am not regretting my purchase. I would definitely buy this phone again.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: Very worth for the money. Great performance when comparing with the same price range mobile phones in the market. And also because of Oppos own OS version, the internal operations are really smooth. Camera is also in very good quality. Highly recommended.

It's a phone that grows on you.The camera is very good and you can also install the pixel camera in addition to the phone camera app and it actually works very well. So you have both the Oppo camera and the Pixel one and you can use both in low light and decided which one you like.

title: Oppo Find X5 Lite - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: I decided to upgrade my old, much loved, Oppo A72. I decided on the Find X5 lite.I like Oppo, the specs looked like an affordable improvement on my old phone. Moving to Android 12 from 11 sounded good too.Having used it for a couple of weeks, I feel like I can give an informed review.Setup:- Pretty straightforward, Connected my old phone to the new one via the included USB charging cable.  It even had a USB A to C adapter in the box. Followed the instructions and was quickly done.Hardware:-  CPU is reasonably quick, the 8gb of RAM makes multitasking smooth. The screen is great, Amoled is vibrant, I have never used a 90hz phone screen and I love it.Cameras:- are fine. I mainly do landscape photography and the weather has made that hard to testStorage: 256gb plus a micro SD gives plenty of space for apps and files.Power:- 4,500 mah gives a full day of regular use. The included (please note Apple!) 65w quick charger gets you back to work quickly.Conclusion:- Very happy, loads of quality of life benefits , capable hardware

title: Oppo Find X5 Lite - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: Reliable phone, good pictures

title: Oppo Find X5 Lite - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: The Oppo Find X5 Lite is a great mobile phone.Setting up was a doddle. I transferred everything from my old phone with ease.It's got 256Gb of internal storage, so plenty to work with. I also added a 128Gb micro SD card to transfer important material like songs and photographs, as I go along.The only slight negative was because it was an Amazon Warehouse ' like new'  phone it didn't come with a charger for some reason. That was rectified for under Â£20.All in, the phone package set me back less than Â£185 which was significantly less than  the full sale price now.It arrived promptly, and was absolutely ' like new '.If anyone is looking for a mobile with great specs, without having to break the bank, then the Oppo Find X5 Lite has got to be on your radar.I love my purchase.

title: Oppo Find X5 Lite - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: I always buy my own smartphones and have had several over the last couple of years. A few months ago I purchased a TCL20R 5g which was a terrible mistake despite many good reviews it was slow, unreliable, lousy camera the list goes on and on. I needed to replace it and decided on the Oppo. Now this phone has a couple of good reviews and lots more that give it very unflattering ratings. Having owned it for just a few days and having pushed all its features to the limits and more, I can only say "What a gem". It is fast enough to please me and everything on it works well and very smoothly. A year or so ago I had a Galaxy S10 and this Oppo blows it away. Now I'm an old codger and not a gamer so I can't speak to its abilities there, but, if you are a grown-up who wants a smoothly operating phone and would like a bargain I can certainly give this my blessing!
