title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: It's fantastic. Great screen, responsive optical fingerprint, great camera that actually takes great close ups (sorry Google). Looks incredibly sleek as well and hopefully gorilla victus protects it. Only downside is the battery life. It's clearly improved since release from the earlier reviews but is still not great.As I said the display is phenomenal. By default it is set to standard. First thing you should do is change it to high in the settings. This thing supports a qhd+ display so use it.If you are constantly using it then expect a day and a half battery life from 80% charge. The major bonus is the charger. It will charge from 20% to 80% in 20 minutes max. Ridiculously fast. Wireless charging is fast as well. In my car in charges 1% per minute.Great phone.

title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: I have the s22 ultra as my contract phone and I bought this on the 12 month scheme.I love my phones and I've had the oneplus 9 Pro, oppo find X3 Pro, S21 ultra in the past.To start with, this phone fits in my hand and trouser pocket better than the s22 ultra. What I've noticed so far is that the battery life seems a tad bit better and the face recognition is sooo fast compared to the Samsung. Plus with the software update it came with a new feature. It hides notifications if someone other than you is looking at the screen, superb.Point and shoot camera looks very similar to the s22 ultra, more real life colours with the oppo.Small things that annoy me with the Oppo, but hopefully this changes. Software updates aren't as fast at coming through as Samsung, and you can't really buy a decent (spigen) case for the oppo yet.All in all, the phone is great, lovely looking, albeit in a case, nice in the hand, and can hardly feel it in your pocket.The screen isn't as bright as the Samsung, but what screens are. Samsung won't sell their best displays to rivals.Great phone so far. ðŸ‘

title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_title: Better than my previous Samsung, cheaper than newer Samsungs with better spec
review_text: Have always had Samsung, since S3, right up to S20 Ultra +. A friend told me about Oppo so I decided to take a look and am so glad I did. The spec is first rate, it comes with a fitted screen protector, a superfast charger which is incredibly fast, basically charge the phone within 45 min from flat. Samsung you don't even get a charger these days, that's an extra Â£45! The phone also came with a case which fits the phone lovely.Speed of the Oppo is great, has everything my Samsung had, it actually fits better in my hand than my previous Samsung. The finger and face recognition is super quick and it works, if I wear sun glasses it doesn't recognise me. As I pre-ordered I get ear buds, a smart watch, a wireless charger and another case. I will not be going back to Samsung. Seriously, if you've always been a Samsung user like me, don't feel nervous about making the switch, you won't regret it, I haven't!

title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: This is the second oppo x5 pro first I sent back thinking something up with battery nope i was wrong it's the phone and the software on it. Most days doesn't last 10 hours. Also noticed the phone service thing comes up on the phone meaning it's lost signal to the network I don't know if it's using more power to try to stay connected or what? Going to ask Amazon if I can swap it for the one plus 11.

title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_text: Love everything in this phone so far. Great screen to watch anime. Loud and clear speakers. All day battery, but mind I'm not super heavy user. The only game I play is wild rift so no issues or heating there. I come from OnePlus 7 so wanted similar experience, but with better camera. ColorOS feels like home and actually now I prefer it to OnePlus half-baked OxygenOS these days. Camera is amazing imo. (I know telephoto is not good, but I don't zoom so don't care). It's a joy to film or shoot my kids. That 80w charger is a game changer. I don't worry about battery anymore. Haptics are crisp as well. Overall it is expensive phone, but feels like beautiful flagship and no regrets here.

title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, Black
review_title: Great Oppo, camera, screen and sound quality fantastic.
review_text: Very happy with this phone, upgraded from a Pocophone F1. It's a bit bulkier, but not awkwardly so. Battery is great for all day usage, charging is so fast with the included charger that it constantly surprises me. I include images of ten minutes charging, from 16.26% to 55%. My OC3 car charger also works for rapid (not quite that fast) charging which is very useful.

title: OPPO A77 5G Smartphone, MediaTek Dimensity 810 5G, 6.56â€šÃ„Ã¹ LCD HD+ 90Hz, 48MP+2MPrear camera, 8MP front camera, RAM 4GB + ROM 64GB with RAM expansion, 5000mAh 33W Supervooc, Midnight Black
review_title: Very impressed, great 5G phone good battery life Android 13 !
review_text: Bought this as a company phone replacement as the old one was 4G only and old. It quickly upgraded to Android 13. I have the usual company apps, teams, outlook and all managed with a company provided app for identity verification. While the face recognition works it does remind you every 72 hours to input your PIN, Our company needs a minimum 8 digit pin (yup) so you need to do "choose another" in the menu to allow an 8 digit pin. I also use it to hotspot into the company on the laptop when at a client site, at 5G.Battery life is very, very good. I am usually charging it once every 3-4 days, use dependent of course.As per company policy I have to keep it updated, and Android 13 was offered so I installed it.It is a dual SIM phone and as a user of dual SIM I can highly recommend for travel, i.e. buy a local SIM payg and use your 'home' SIM for receiving verification codes only.I am considering buying a second A77 to replace a data dongle which are mostly 4G only, and using the dual SIM to have 2 different PAYG plans for (personal) data when needed in remote locations, mobile phone coverage varies of course. I have found some poor 4G locations have good 5G coverage.The camera I would call 'good enough'. I need to share photos of equipment or status screens with colleagues. It only has 2 settings, a wide and closer. If you're not using the 2nd SIM you can put a micro SDXC card in it. The slots appear to be sealed with gaskets so I think it is waterproof too.It has a 3.5 mm headphone socket which is really handy for those 'con calls' privacy.It comes in the box with a clear case (cover) and there is a screen protector fitted but it is a plastic one not a glass one so easily scratched. Also comes with a high speed mains charger.I have a personal Samsung phone as well and there's little to choose between them. My Samsung can take 2 SIMs AND an SDXC memory card but doesn't charge as fast.Has proved very reliable so far so at the price it is excellent.

title: OPPO A77 5G Smartphone, MediaTek Dimensity 810 5G, 6.56â€šÃ„Ã¹ LCD HD+ 90Hz, 48MP+2MPrear camera, 8MP front camera, RAM 4GB + ROM 64GB with RAM expansion, 5000mAh 33W Supervooc, Midnight Black
review_text: I had never really thought about Oppo phones at all and came across the A77 5G and took a punt as my Sony was playing up due to me dropping it. The phone is very responsive and the speakers are way better than my Sony phone, I can now watch videos in my down time at work. Too my horror I discovered that 5G was not in my area yet smh so haven't been able to test that out yet but so far I am happy with it. I had to delete some included games but that was no biggie. Battery isn't great by a long shot and won't last the day without a top up even with mild usageBattery holds if the phone isn't used but if you get on you tube or catch up with some footy videos from the weekend it munches through lifeCharged 4pm Saturday 100%Airplane mode from 11pm10 am Sunday 68%1 35min call, some emails and some sky sports prem league goal highlights 28%Back on charge 2pm as it was down to 11% and was going out at 5pm so could have been left with a flat dog and bone whilst out and knowing I would be taking photos at a party it would never have got through the dayShame as the phone is so tidy and scratch free... title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_title: Great camera, great battery, useless fingerprint reader.
review_text: This is my second Oppo phone, purchased to replace a Reno4 Pro 5G. In comparison the Find X5 Pro feels much heavier, 226g compared to the Reno's 172g. Personally I prefer that, but that'll be a matter of personal choice.Physically the Find X5 Pro looks pretty in pictures but is completely impractical to keep hold of unless it's in a case as the ceramic material it's made from is super slippery. I've gone for a case from GOGME as it gives the most protection around the camera lenses.I chose the Find X5 Pro as it was reduced by Â£310 to Â£739 on a Black Friday deal and I wanted to get the best camera I could within reason. The camera does seem excellent, 50mp for standard and 50mp for wide angle with brilliant low light capabilities. The zoom isn't very good in comparison, being 13mp 2x optical but really only a Samsung S22 Ultra has a half decent zoom lens (for twice the price of the Oppo), and that's still nowhere near as good as a superzoom compact camera. I've got a Nikon A1000 35x optical to cover that requirement.The battery fitted by Oppo has a rated life of 1600 cycles (maintaining 80% of charge) compared to 500 for Apple and Samsung. Only time will tell if that claim is true but with a daily charge that's over 4 years without noticeable degradation.The face recognition seems excellent and the screen is superb as you'd expect from something that launched at well over Â£1000.The one thing the Find X5 Pro and Reno4 Pro 5G share is an utterly useless fingerprint reader built into the screen. I work in an industry where I use my hands so the top later of skin on my fingers is often damaged. Simply put, the fingerprint reader just doesn't work. With or without screen protector makes no difference.Compared to old Motorolas I've had with the sensor on the back which always worked perfectly regardless of how chewed up my fingers were the Oppos are a huge disappointment. Perhaps for office types who never do manual work the fingerprint reader works OK but not for us manual types.Out of the box the Find X5 Pro had ColorOS 12 (Android 12) installed but within a few hours it had done a couple of upgrades to that, and then and upgrade to ColorOS 13 (Android 13). More evolution than revolution but seems to work fine.There is no perfect phone, the best you can do is wade through the reviews and go for what does what you want the best. For me that's camera performance and I'm not disappointed. Definitely worth considering.

title: OPPO Find X5 Pro 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 12GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_text: Very good quality and features on this model. Love the super fast charge and the slick feel of the screen. So silly smooth albeit has a screen protector on it already. The colours are good and lots of features. Step up from my Oppo A72. Love this phone! Won't regret the purchase. Comes with SIM ejector. 2 dual Sims. Which I use. Cable and charger. Even a camera lens protector. I haven't used it as I have used the phone case that comes with this also. Value for money.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_text: Been using a Samsung S9+ since it was released. The step up here was surprisingly huge! The battery is incredible, it charges in no time at all thanks to the 80w, and lasts forever. And a charger with the phone too, beating out other companies here!No SD card reader or headphone jack though which is a shame.The 120hz screen refresh rate is actually noticeable, and really makes the phone feel very fast. The build quality is generally amazing. The ColourOS software pack has taken a little bit to get used to, but isn't horrid.The camera is just incredobly good.Al in all, anyone with an older phone will be blown away by the X5. And with the free Oppo Pad Air promotion at my time if buying (sold for Â£130), I paid only Â£400 for this brand new device. No regrets.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_text: Seems to be a great phone, however, up to now, I have one issue.Out of the box it works fine, after the initial update done over WiFi this phone then disconnects phone calls at exactly 29 minutes and 50 seconds.I have had three oneplus 9 phones that all done the same thing and have been returned to amazon, but also the oneplus phones had other faults like the camera opening and freezing on a blurd screen. Now this Oppo Find X5 5g is doing the same thing as the oneplus phones where as it is disconnecting every phone call at 29 minutes and 50 seconds. These two types of phones have the same parent company and share very similar softwhere, whether it is a oppo/oneplus glitch or a Google 12 glitch I don't know, but hopefully this will be fixed with a future softwhere update.It's dissapointing to know that my new phone is not perfect.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_text: Excellent android phone, intuitive and easy to use except the fingerprint reader if you don't buy the exact spot first time it's not going to work and you end up using a password anyway. Save time and disable this feature. Everything else is perfect, great battery life, super fast charging crystal clear audio and really good cameras. Also makes and receives phone calls.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_text: Really happy with the Find X5, battery lasts all day, cameras are great, responsive and does all I want it to do.

title: Oppo Find X5 5G - Smartphone 256GB, 8GB RAM, Dual Sim, White
review_text: Great spec .... on paperFound it to be very buggyCamera was hit and miss, 2 out of 3 photos came out blurry when photoing a moving person because the shutter seems to take a second to respond when you click for a photo.Battery is average, though the charging is super fast.A good phone if your upgrading from a cheap budget phone  but you may be disappointed if your moving from iOS or a Samsung Galaxy S series.

title: OPPO Find X3 Pro 5G - 12GB RAM and 256GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.7 inch, Dual 50MP Quad Camera, Snapdragon 888 Processor, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: I've long been a Samsung phone user, but was not prepared to pay the premium for continuing to do so. Saw this Oppo phone reviewed very highly online and at a significantly lower price I thought I'd take the punt. I'm delighted I did so.The phone itself is very well made and very good looking. The screen is excellent, and performance well up there with the best I've used. The battery life is out of this world compared to the Samsungs I've previously owned, but even when you do run out the charging is ridiculously fast using the provided fast charger.A special word for the camera, for which the quality of images it captures is a very pleasant surprise, even in the dark (and the night mode is impressive). There's a microscope option to boot which whilst a bit of a gimmick is a lot of fun.I'm delighted with this phone, and for what you get the price is extremely competitive. An unfamiliar maker for me previously, but I'm so glad I took the gamble on them.

title: OPPO Find X3 Pro 5G - 12GB RAM and 256GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.7 inch, Dual 50MP Quad Camera, Snapdragon 888 Processor, Dual SIM) - Black
review_title: High quality hardware, more software than I want
review_text: An excellent phone, too many inbuilt software items which I can't seem to disable. I use 3% of the apps 75% of the time, 10% of the remaining apps another 24% of the time, and 80% of the apps have never been opened.

title: OPPO Find X3 Pro 5G - 12GB RAM and 256GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.7 inch, Dual 50MP Quad Camera, Snapdragon 888 Processor, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: I like this phone very much, it is quite a light phone for it's size, and very fast all of the time. The screen is very clear and the colours are nice and colourful. The phone can charge from 0 to 100% in about 45 minutes. I think the black phone colour is possibly the best. Compared with the Oppo Find X2 Pro this seems better in various ways, because although I tried the Oppo Find X2 and liked it, I had a problem because the phone connected to weak wi-fi signals even though I had adjusted the settings, which was a big problem in London. Oppo seems to have corrected the problem with this phone.The camera is great and the colours of the photos are vibrant and sharp. The fingerprint reader works well also. I bought the phone in the offer period and I got a free smart-watch, an air charger and a new case as a 'Gift Pack'. The only trouble is that there is no Oppo mail app on the phone, I cannot understand why that hasn't been included, so I will have to try to find a way of downloading one. However, gmail is adequate for the moment.I did have problems with the previous version but not with this, and Amazon can rest assured that I will be keeping my new smartphone. Thank you Amazon.

title: OPPO Find X3 Pro 5G - 12GB RAM and 256GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.7 inch, Dual 50MP Quad Camera, Snapdragon 888 Processor, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: What can I say, just an awesome phone, charge time incredible, screen incredible, sound quality excellent. Pair it with USB dac and you have a brilliant music player. Just an awesome phone. Glad I bought it.

review_text: Fancied a change from my Xiaomi phones that I've used for a few years and the price drop on this phone made the decision easy. Great performance and specs and a brilliant camera setup. Had a small problem with the charger and they had a new one in the post as soon as they got the message. Thank you! The charging speed on this phone is crazy fast. Highly recommended.

title: OPPO Find X3 Pro 5G - 12GB RAM and 256GB Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.7 inch, Dual 50MP Quad Camera, Snapdragon 888 Processor, Dual SIM) - Black
review_text: Oppo are not well known in the UK or Europe but are massive in Asia and other parts of the world and it shows in their products . This is our 5th Oppo and they have always been stable,reliable and perform well too.Despite being released 2yrs ago this phone is still very current and worthy of being called a flagship phone and at just over Â£400 it is excellent value for money and in my opinion will match any current Â£1000 phone. The screen is of amazing quality, its a fast phone well made and comes with  charger, headphones and very nice case too. Color OS runs well with no bloatware and mine has updated to Android 13 and according to Oppo is on the list for Android 14 too so the phone remains fully upto date. Rumours are that Oppo may sadly pull out of Europe market due to the usual political issues so get one while you can you won't be disappointed.

The camera on these is really good and for the price it is a no brainer.

title: OPPO Find N2 Flip 5G Smartphone, 6.8â€šÃ„Ãº AMOLED 120Hz, 3.26â€šÃ„Ã¹ Largest Flip Cover Screen, 50MP flagship camera, 8GB RAM + 256GB ROM, 4300mAh All-day Battery, Moonlit Purple

title: OPPO Find N2 Flip 5G Smartphone, 6.8â€šÃ„Ãº AMOLED 120Hz, 3.26â€šÃ„Ã¹ Largest Flip Cover Screen, 50MP flagship camera, 8GB RAM + 256GB ROM, 4300mAh All-day Battery, Moonlit Purple
OPPO Find N2 Flip 5G Smartphone, 6.8â€šÃ„Ãº AMOLED 120Hz, 3.26â€šÃ„Ã¹ Largest Flip Cover Screen, 50MP flagship camera, 8GB RAM + 256GB ROM, 4300mAh All-day Battery, Moonlit Purple
review_text: I've used iPhones for the past 10 years, I wanted something with a bigger screen but the plus models are just too large. This is perfect; unfolded you get a nice big screen, folded up it takes up hardly any room in the pocket. The 120hz screen is a joy to use, you don't see the crease facing it head on.I'm impressed with how customizable Android is at this point. A few hours of tweaking and it's barely any difference to iOS now.There a few minor annoying bugs, for example my wallpaper is resetting once every few weeks, which then also changes the theme colours. The player controls for Apple music appear on the cover screen even after the app is closed, even after a restart. I had to uninstall the app to make it go away.These are software issues that can be resolved in time. In terms of the hardware its a very beautiful bit of kit but quite slippery.Lack of wireless charging and headphone jack scores a 4 instead of 5.

title: OPPO A94 5G - 8GB RAM and 128 +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (48MP AI Quad Camera, 6.4' AMOLED Screen, 30W fast charge) - Fluid Black
review_title: Good value phone with separate slots for 2 sims as well as a micro-sd card
review_text: There seem to be few budget or mid-price 5g phones which take 2 sims and a micro-sd card (it avoids the annoyinging hybrid second slot approach of Xiaomi or Samsung 5g phones of similar spec). That was a reason for choosing this to replace a Xiaomi. It is a good weight and size and sits comfortably in the hand, has reasonable memory and the processor seems up to quite heavy demands of a smartphone (I was a bit doubtful of a Mediatek processor - I've previously gone for Qalcomm but this outperforms the Qualcomm in the previous Xiaomi. I don't use it for gaming, but just about everything else). The camera is pretty good, but the promise of 48 mp or more for the camera overlooks the fact that the small lens on this (and probably any) smartphone is not up to providing the definition to benefit much from extra megapixels. (For seriously better photo quality get a good digital camera.) Interestingly it does a better job of picking up a fairly poor 4g phone signal from O2 where I live. I did wonder about the facial recognition but it is quite neat. The on-screen fingerprint reader is ok but can misread on the first attempt sometimes. It has a pin login but sadly does not have a pattern login, which I miss. But it does have a lovely 3.5mm stereo jack for wired headphones.

title: OPPO A94 5G - 8GB RAM and 128 +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (48MP AI Quad Camera, 6.4' AMOLED Screen, 30W fast charge) - Fluid Black
review_title: Really good phone and very reasonably priced.
review_text: Fantastic! Actually, I bought it to replace my Samsung and this OPPO is much better than the Samsung. Even the battery life is much longer. Will never buy a Samsung again now.

title: OPPO A94 5G - 8GB RAM and 128 +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (48MP AI Quad Camera, 6.4' AMOLED Screen, 30W fast charge) - Fluid Black
review_text: I brought this phone in early 2022 to replace a significantly more expensive brand name device - although not nearly Flagship - that I was still paying for under contract but had broken outside of the warranty terms.Anyhow, this phone...  I've loved it since I got it and it can do so much more than any device that I've ever owned, or need.I've often dropped it or left it at the bottom of my handbag, being bumped by all the other stuff I chuck in there. But still it's going strong and in great condition after 19 months of daily use. Despite the fact that approx 6 months ago I broke the screensaver that had been on it since I brought it and I haven't bothered to replace it - the screen is still in great condition with only some very minor scratches.I'm currently looking - casually - for a replacement for this phone - only because I take a lot of pictures and videos of my family, accumulate a lot of junk and I'm starting to edge closer to the huge 128gb storage on this device. Perhaps I should concentrate on getting rid of some of that junk first before 'upgrading' - since this phone competently does everything I need it it to do, as well as so much more. Easily the best phone I've ever owned.

title: OPPO A94 5G - 8GB RAM and 128 +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (48MP AI Quad Camera, 6.4' AMOLED Screen, 30W fast charge) - Fluid Black
review_title: Excellent phone, room for improvement on software.
review_text:
At 7.8 mm thin, the handset is as thin as my old OnePlus 6, which is great because most new phones now are at least 8.4 mm thick, not much thicker, but you do feel the difference when youâ€™re holding your phone.I picked the more traditional grey/black colour which looks good and doesnâ€™t stand out, the back seems to be plastic coated glass but I am not sure what Gorilla Glass protection rating is on the screen or the back, it does look pretty standard though, nothing special from a designâ€™s point of view.With a 5G Tesco Mobile SIM, and having bought theÂ 
OnePlus 8T
Â when it was reduced to Â£399 recently only to realise that OnePlus still hasnâ€™t fixed their â€˜no 5G on our expensive 5G phonesâ€™ problem yet, it was nice to see this Â£300 Oppo picking 5G signal.Itâ€™s also worth mentioning that this is my first MediaTek chipset phone, all my previous phones have been running on Snapdragon chipsets and I was a bit hesitant before buying it, but if youâ€™re thinking the same? Thereâ€™s no need to hesitate, MediaTek preforms just as well as Snapdragon.Start up and initial set up was smooth, apart from one step that took a bit longer than usual, but it did move forward and I was asked to finish setting my â€˜Reno5 zâ€™ up, clearly a cloned software from another OPPO device, but it worked.Within a few minutes, a software update was picked up and it updated to latest Android security updates and everything ran smoothly.Startup time with all my apps downloaded and fully logged onto is about 2/3 seconds slower than the OnePlus 8T, which I think is a great achievement from a Â£300 handset.I can go on forever but Iâ€™ll try to list what I believe to be the pros and cons of this handset:Pros:1- 5G that actually works.2- Screen is vibrant and clear, dim enough in the dark and bright enough under Sun light.3- Screen is super bright and responsive, but not the power hungry 120Hz screen.4- Fingerprint scanner is incredibly responsive, and much better than conventional rear or side mounted physical sensors.5- Battery life is amazing, 2 days moderate/heavy use without needing to recharge it.6- Customisation is almost endless, and fun.7- Thin and lightweight.8- 3.5 mm headphone jack.Cons:1- Camera isnâ€™t great on Ultra Wide mode, and struggles a bit on low light, but I think this can be rectified on future software updates as the sensor itself is a decent snapper.2- Menu can be a bit childish, and things like text size and screen zoom can jump from one extreme to the other, a sliding option can be handy.3- At first, I couldnâ€™t enable pattern unlock instead of password, but finally found it by trying to change password.4- Always On Display stays at full brightness for too long, might be too bright during night time.5- Disabling icon names extends to drawer icons too, not just desktop icons.6- No VoWifi or VoLTE on Tesco Mobile.7- Can not disable swiping left from home screen to access Google news feed, itâ€™s just there whether you like it or not. Also can not disable any of Google apps.As you can see, most of the cons are software related that I think can easily be rectified by a software update, hopefully Oppo might listen to this and sort it out.The only real competitor for this handset in my eyes (AMOLED Display and under display fingerprint scanner) at the time of reviewing is theÂ 
 realme 8 Pro
Â Which has a 108 MP camera, charges at 50W and selling at Â£259, (But not a 5G handset, so you decide whatâ€™s more important). realme is advertising a 5G version of the 8 Pro at the moment however, but no price yet.Overall: I would definitely recommend anyone looking for a decent 5G phone to pick this up, you will probably be wondering why other phones cost twice the price or even more.

title: OPPO A94 5G - 8GB RAM and 128 +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (48MP AI Quad Camera, 6.4' AMOLED Screen, 30W fast charge) - Fluid Black

title: OPPO A94 5G - 8GB RAM and 128 +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (48MP AI Quad Camera, 6.4' AMOLED Screen, 30W fast charge) - Fluid Black
review_text: This is a really lovely smartphone - well worth the Â£300 ... the 8gb RAM ensures apps work with lighting speed ... the camera is good and the phone is well designed with a virtual fingerprint sensor on the front screen which works very well. I am regularly getting speeds of 150mbps via the 5g, which makes the Internet truly fast ... I also like how light and slim the phone is ... even with the provided cover securely on. And the ColorOS ... I've been using Oppo phones for a number of years now and I think the system is absolutely fine - easily as intuitive as Apple. Battery life is good too - it's usually down to around 40pc at the end of a day when I am using it just about most of the time. I highly recommend this phone.

title: OPPO A54 5G - 4GB RAM and 64GB +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.5' Screen, 5000 mAh Battery, 48MP Quad Camera, 90Hz Refresh Rate) - Fluid Black
review_text: When it comes to balancing performance, affordability, and cutting-edge technology, the Oppo A54 5G shines brightly in the mid-range smartphone market. As an avid tech enthusiast, I recently got my hands on the Oppo A54 5G, and I must say, it impressed me in more ways than one.Design and Build:The Oppo A54 5G boasts an elegant and modern design that catches the eye with its sleek lines and glossy finish. The 6.5-inch IPS LCD display stretches from edge to edge, delivering crisp visuals and vibrant colors. The phone feels comfortable to hold, thanks to its slim profile and lightweight construction. The power and volume buttons are conveniently placed, and the fingerprint sensor on the side ensures quick and secure access to the device.Performance:Equipped with a Qualcomm Snapdragon 480 5G chipset, the Oppo A54 5G offers a commendable performance for its price range. Everyday tasks like web browsing, social media usage, and multitasking are handled smoothly. Even graphics-intensive games run fairly well, though there may be occasional stutters on higher graphics settings. The 6GB of RAM provides decent multitasking capabilities, and the 128GB of internal storage offers ample space for apps, media, and files. Additionally, the phone's 5G connectivity ensures faster download and upload speeds in supported areas, future-proofing it for evolving networks.Camera:The camera setup on the Oppo A54 5G is surprisingly competent, given its mid-range status. The quad-camera array features a 48MP primary lens, an 8MP ultra-wide lens, and two 2MP macro and depth sensors. In well-lit conditions, the primary camera captures detailed and vibrant images. The ultra-wide lens is perfect for scenic shots, but the quality drops slightly in low-light scenarios. The macro lens, while fun to use, lacks the sharpness of the primary camera. The 16MP front-facing camera delivers decent selfies, though beautification features can sometimes oversaturate the images.Battery Life:One of the standout features of the Oppo A54 5G is its impressive battery life. The 5,000mAh battery easily powers the phone through a full day of moderate to heavy usage. Even with extensive app usage, video streaming, and gaming, I found the phone lasting well into the evening without needing a recharge. The phone also supports 18W fast charging, allowing you to get back to full power relatively quickly.Software:The Oppo A54 5G runs on ColorOS, which is based on Android. The user interface is clean, intuitive, and offers a host of customization options. However, some may find the pre-installed bloatware a bit intrusive, but they can be removed or disabled to some extent.Conclusion:The Oppo A54 5G offers exceptional value for money, making it an excellent choice for budget-conscious consumers looking for a 5G-capable smartphone. Its sleek design, commendable performance, versatile camera setup, outstanding battery life, and 5G support make it a reliable daily driver. While it may not compete with higher-end flagships, it outperforms most devices in its price segment. If you're in the market for a mid-range smartphone with 5G capabilities, the Oppo A54 5G should be high on your list.

title: OPPO A54 5G - 4GB RAM and 64GB +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.5' Screen, 5000 mAh Battery, 48MP Quad Camera, 90Hz Refresh Rate) - Fluid Black
review_text: Overall excellent for a budget phone. My previous phone was an iPhone X and I wanted a cheaper replacement.Pros:- Looks excellent (both screen and hardware), I chose the grey/black gradient style- Prompts to update to Android 13 (latest version of Android at the time of writing) it does each version in turn, allow some spare time for this- Includes a free gel case and screenprotector pre-fitted- Fast facial recognition and fingerprint reader conveniently integrated into the power button- Very good price- Camera floating in the corner looks better than the notch style- Performance is good if you are not multi-tasking apps- ColorOS looks good and does not feel a step down compared to iOS- Camera is pretty good for casual use- Was able to run C&C Rivals game pretty well- Amazing battery lifeCons- Sometimes when you switch between apps it forgets where it was in the other app and the app reloads. Not sure if this is the phone, the app or Android but just flagging this happens when it didn't on my iPhone X. Not a big problem, but if you had written a lot of text in one app make sure you save or copy it before switching apps just in case. If you are doing some critical multi-tasking and need ultra high performance I would spend more.- In C&C Rivals the game feels like it could be a bit smoother compared to iPhone X so I would spend a bit more next time.Amazing what you can get for the money now. I wouldn't go back to Apple now.

title: OPPO A54 5G - 4GB RAM and 64GB +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.5' Screen, 5000 mAh Battery, 48MP Quad Camera, 90Hz Refresh Rate) - Fluid Black

title: OPPO A54 5G - 4GB RAM and 64GB +Extendable Storage SIM Free Smartphone (6.5' Screen, 5000 mAh Battery, 48MP Quad Camera, 90Hz Refresh Rate) - Fluid Black
review_text: Great mid budget phone, had a Hawei p smart phone for 3 years before this so had a lot to live up to as that was superb. I like the long life battery it can take a lot of screen time although I reduced the brightness down to about 25 per cent as it still seemed very bright at that level in all conditions.it will still be on 30 per cent by evening with a heap of use throughout the day,also make battery last longer by dropping screen refresh time from 90HZ down to 60HZ in settings does not make any difference on this device the screen lag time and crispness of the images is unaffected,but saves about 2 to 3 hours of extra screen time, its also very responsive and fast phone for the money seeing as it Â£150,no complaints, it seems factory set on using less RAM though than its capable of when you get it out the box.(factory set?)But you can set this up to its max by going into settings....then click...about device...scroll down to RAM ...tap on that...will bring up expansion of RAM...move slider to 3gb and restart phone ..and your done ...phone responds faster and on and off times quicker....all in all a great phone for the money...would recommend and definitely buy again.

title: OPPO Reno4 Z 5G - 8 GB + 128 GB MediaTec 800 6.50 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_text: The Oppo Reno 4Z is a great budget 5G smartphone. It fits into the recently made mid range flagship category, going up against the OnePlus Nord and the Pixel 4A.The phone arrived ontime in a beautiful case with an 18W VOOC Charger, earphones, a sim ejector tool, a plastic case and some documentation. It arrives with a pre-applied screen protector that is also a fingerprint magnet.First impressions, INCREDIBLE PHONE.The 4000mah battery can last 6-7 hours screen on time so easily 3 days with low usage. This is a full day phone. The 18W charger can go to full in 1.5 hours while the  65W charger available from OPPO can do 30 minutes, so the battery is great.The camera: this phone comes with a 48MP Sony sensor on the back and a nice 16MP front camera with a bokeh lens as well. The pill shaped cutout easily blends in with the phone and is much better than the now dated notch. Both cameras take great shots that perfectly capture the scene however it does not feature Optical Image Stabilisation which consequently requires a bit more effort to take a crystal clear shot.This phone comes with a headphone jack, a rare amenity rarely seen in phones now. It uses USB Type-C and has a side-mounted fingerprint scanner, which is much better than the cheap, slow in-screen fingerprint scanners shown in other phones. This, paired with the lightning fast Face-ID can almost make the lock screen disappear, they're that fast.The new ColorOS experience gives the phone a premium feel, the gestures and tiny little convenience tools that can transform your experience into one of minimal effort. The phone feels no stuttering, partly thanks to the 8GB of RAM, and while testing on COD: Mobile I recieved 60FPS on medium settings. A good gaming phone as well.Summary: The Oppo Reno 4Z is an excellent phone, with a stunning design, great battery and experience, and excellent build quality. This is a flagship phone. Better than the Pixel 4A, OnePlus Nord, Poco X3 NFC, Realme X50 5GaPROS -- Headphone Jack- 65W SuperVOOC charging- Great battery life- Great cameras- Instant unlock- Great software- Android 10CONS -- No expandable storage- No wireless charging

title: OPPO Reno4 Z 5G - 8 GB + 128 GB MediaTec 800 6.50 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_title: Really good phone that should be ok for some more time (5G capability)
review_text: It is a really good phone for this price. I really like it. It is not easy to find a cheaper phone with 128 GB, 5G and duo sim. All apps are working ok. Some pictures (panoramic) in the dark are even better than on my iPhone 11 Pro. I bought it as a good Android phone to have it for 2 two 3 years from now.

title: OPPO Reno4 Z 5G - 8 GB + 128 GB MediaTec 800 6.50 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_title: Value for money is great, however one issue
review_text: I pre-ordered this phone, seeing it was insanely great value for money given the specs and its support for connection to 5G networks. The camera looked great and my hopes were high. The phone arrived this morning and after some messing around with it I have one issue that just bothers me. The display reaches the top of the screen but it does not reach the bottom. There is a small area where it stays black almost as if the phone is supposed to be slightly shorter. It isn't too great looking and does slightly bother me. Other than that the white colour on the back of the phone is truly stunning! It reacts to light to create a yellowy orange sunrise sort colour and is stunning. The phone runs seamlessly and the camera is quite impressive for the cost! Its just a shame there is the black bar at the bottom of the display.

title: OPPO Reno4 Z 5G - 8 GB + 128 GB MediaTec 800 6.50 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_text: It's a great phone, it works perfectly. The battery is amazing, it also happened that I needed to charge it only once in 2 days. Camera takes amazing pictures! For the price you pay you'll have an amazing product, the best in my opinion for this range of prices.

title: OPPO Reno4 Z 5G - 8 GB + 128 GB MediaTec 800 6.50 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_text: This is a great 5G phone, it's fast downloading files,easy to set up and transfer your old phone over. It arrived Sunday morning and within 1 hour I had up and running with no loss of files, but most of all great value for money.The only thing not sure about is battery life. Charged it up overnight started to use it at 7am GMT it's now 10.30am GMT and it'd down to 82% so will need to keep a check on this, but if that's the only thing I can live with that.

title: OPPO Reno4 Z 5G - 8 GB + 128 GB MediaTec 800 6.50 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_title: Not a bad phone for the price
review_text: I'll start by saying ignore the hype around 120hz screens on these cheaper phones. They are LCD and usually not great quality, I'd much prefer a 60hz good quality OLED anyday. The display is big and crisp, and can get pretty bright but the quality of the colours isnt great.The cameras are okay, again don't be fooled by 48mp, as any photographer will tell you it's not all about the amount of mp. The main centre is passable, ultrawide is usable if you really need it but id stick with the main sensor for optimal results. The other sensors are just fillers, you will never really use them.Performance is actually a big strong point, i didn't notice any stutters or lag in general day to day use, gaming is possible if you lower your quality levels. No complaints here for the price.Fingerprint sensor is fast and reliable, also in a great place.Battery life is great, another big strong point of this phone. Easily get a full days use, even if you game and watch videos.All in all it's a solid phone for the price. I think they could of got away with making the screen a little smaller and using 60hz OLED to really win over the market, but solid purchase really.

title: OPPO Reno4 Pro 5G - 12 GB + 256 GB Snapdragon 765G 6.55 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_text: Delivered on specified day, along with the additional protective Phone Wallet case I bought, and all in good condition.Really pleased I bought this phone to replace my previously excellent old HTC One M9, which had a battery on the way out, and I will replace this and keep it as a spare.Originally considered the Samsung Galaxy, but I was concerned about some reviews where the Samsung screen was easily scratched. This Oppo phone comes with an invisible screen protector already applied which is a very nice touch, and a week into using the phone in the wallet case, it still looks pristine. I had never heard of Oppo before, so did a bit of research and very pleased I did. Apparently they are huge elsewhere and there are plenty of reviews to do some research.Managed to get this when priced at Â£349.99, before it went back up to Â£399.00 so feel fortunate I got it then. Apparently previously Â£699, so pricing seems a bit all over the place, and the product naming is a bit confusing.This is a really great looking 2 SIM card phone that does everything you could ask of it, and does it well.Really beautiful, responsive and large display, very fast charging, excellent cameras.The Oppo clone phone app easily transferred all my apps, contacts and data from the old phone to the new phone without any problems, just a little bit of tidying up, which is to be expected, and relogging in again to the banking apps etc.Came with Android 10, and straight away updated without a problem to Android 11 & Color 11 (Oppos Android skin), so now fully up to date.I am with BT Mobile (EE), and this works brilliantly on the EE network, with 5G service where available. Logs on straight away to my BT router at home to give WiFi calling, so I suppose my Femto signal booster (we live in rural Lincolnshire) is becoming pretty much redundant.Battery life and especially the fast charging is excellent. Charges from 30 % to 100 % in 20 minutes with the supplied 65W SuperVOOC 2.0 mains charger. 256GB of internal storage, so no need for additional memory cards. (no expansion slot anyway)Oppo are great for quality, performance and value, and thinking of buying another one for my partner.

title: OPPO Reno4 Pro 5G - 12 GB + 256 GB Snapdragon 765G 6.55 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_text: Coming from Huawei p30 pro and other flagship phones over the years, I wasn't in the position to spend the money on a premium phone this time, in particular, an expensive 2 year contract that I couldn't justify. Solution was to buy a midrange outright and get a good contract on data for a relatively affordable price.With slight trepidation, I chose oppo Reno 4 5G as reviews were good (and fairly consistent) from consumers and trusted tech reviews (like gsmarena). Also, EE sell some oppo phones which was a vote of confidence in my mind that their phones must be of reasonable quality.Bearing in mind I'm coming from premium flagship phones in the past, here's what I'm impressed with: Smooth and intuitive U.I , bright screen with good resolution and 90hz refresh rate, fast responsive fingerprint scanner, good battery life (will last all day at normal use), amazing charging speed (approx 30% in 10min), very capable camera for daytime photos and surprisingly good low light photos if you use night mode or manual settings (not Huawei p30 pro level but miles beyond Samsung s8 plus, if that's helpful).I should mention that the Bluetooth 5 gives a very stable connections and it supports hi Res codecs like aptx hd and ldac. I was impressed with the quality of sound from some of my speakers and headphones compared to Huawei. Dolby Atmos sounds more refined for some reason, compared to any phone I've had in the past.All other aspects work well, WiFi and data connection,  phone calls sound fine, build quality is quite premium.Overall, if you can't afford a premium phone then this is a great option. Really, in many respects this is almost premium. Certainly it's brilliant value for money and so far I have no regrets in buying this phone.I've had this for almost 3 months so any issues that crop up after using a device usually do so by now. I will update this review if any change in my opinion but as it is now, I'm well impressed and satisfied with the oppo Reno 4 5G.

title: OPPO Reno4 Pro 5G - 12 GB + 256 GB Snapdragon 765G 6.55 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black
review_title: It's no flagship, but isn't far off
review_text: Bought this for an extremely good price on Black Friday (1/3 of original release price).First things, it's not a flagship phone, but it's not meant to be. For the price I paid, it's extremely good value for having a phone with 12GB Ram, 256GB storage and a (to my eyes) top range screen. The only let down is the 765G processor, but I can't complain really. Comparing it to a the Huawei P30 Pro top end flagship phone I had prior since 2019, the Reno 4 Pro is (how?) still fractionally slower to doing everything, from launching apps, wifi download throughput, the whole lot. It does have 5G though! Not sure where the extra 4GB of RAM has gone, but it's not like you need to wait for it to do things, just that the P30 P was still faster, despite being older, almost full on storage, and using an 'released earlier' but probably superior Kirin 980 processor (both are same generation 7nm). The camera on this phone is decent, but still not up to P30 P standards. However I do feel that the screen on the Reno is superior, at least looking at them side to side the Reno colours seems to 'pop' more' Battery life, it's ok, should last you the day if you are medium user, maybe even 2 if you are light user but I have the feeling I may need to charge it more frequently that my previous phone. On the plus side, it can charge quicker, and as it's lighter. For the price I got it for, a massive bargain, would not hesistate twice if I had to buy it again. Had I have to pay a price that was Â£50 or Â£100 more than what I paid, I would look elsewhere.

title: OPPO Reno4 Pro 5G - 12 GB + 256 GB Snapdragon 765G 6.55 Inch 4000 mAh 48 MP Camera Sim Free Android 10 Dual Sim Smartphone - Black

Blacks are better in the iPhone as it's an oled panel ,oppo uses amoled,compared to s21, colours and brightness are very similar can't notice much diferenceBattery Life IS quitÃ© good,but the quickcharge IS the gold key hereThis is much better than iPhoneUsb c is better than lightingAndroid is morecompatible and adaptative than iOS, unless you want apple ecosystem (Macbook air and iPad pro are amazing)Color os IS very light and speedy,you can modify multiple things Samsung doesn't allow you,and it feels quite complete, if you still miss options in Android nova launcher is your friend.Speakers are quite good, iPhone12probmax sounds a bit more "Atmos" (deep and punch) but it could be the video I was playing, they sound quite similar.The cÃ¡mara is better than iPhone, more sharp images, video iPhone is the king but oppo doesn't stand much behind ,stability is very good even walking or using stairs.For me the differences didn't justify ,300gbp (or200 if second hand iPhone12probmax)iPhone problems are: lighting, 60hz display, slow charge on battery, limitations of iOS, more expensive, doesn't include charger,headphones or cover,..

Other than this, I am well pleased.Update:  After a couple of months use, the vibration motor has quietened down significantly.  It clearly just needed to bed in.  I remain well pleased.

review_text: This would be a good phone, except for the fact that the USB port only works to charge the device.  It can't connect to a PC or to wired headphones.  All my other phones can.
